The CPSU Scheme Phase-II is a Government Producer Scheme for setting up 12,000 MW grid-connected Solar PV Projects.
The scheme is supported by VGF (Viability Gap Funding) for self-use by the government or through DISCOMs.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the CPSU Scheme Phase-II is the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy.
The component of the CPSU Scheme Phase-II is Finance.
The applicant for the CPSU Scheme Phase-II are Government Producers (PSUs/Govt. Orgnns.) under administrative control or with 50% shareholding of Central/State Govt.
The GoI Support offered for the CPSU Scheme Phase-II is VGF of up to Rs. 70 lakhs/MW, with the actual VGF decided through bidding for the required VGF.
The mode of allocation for the CPSU Scheme Phase-II is bidding through SECI on VGF required.
The usage of solar power under the CPSU Scheme Phase-II is for Self-Use or use by Other Govt. Organisations through Discoms.
The CPSU Scheme Phase-II has a Domestic Content Requirement for domestically manufactured solar PV cells & Modules.
The Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme is also known as the Indian Footwear Leather and Accessories Development Programme.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme is the Ministry of Commerce and Industries.
The component of the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme is Finance.

The applicants for the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme are all existing leather units in the leather, footwear, and accessories industry, including tanneries, leather goods, saddlery, leather footwear, non-leather footwear, and footwear component sectors.

Eligible applicants for the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme must have cash profits for 2 years and undertake viable and bankable programmes of technology upgradation on or after January 1, 2016.
New eligible units for the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme will be considered only upon submission of required documents from all concerned departments.
The Quantum of Assistance for the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme incentivizes investment and manufacturing, including job creation.
The assistance provided under the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme is a backend investment grant/subsidy of 30% of the cost of plant and machinery for MSMEs.
The assistance provided under the Integrated Development of Leather Sector Sub Scheme is a backend investment grant/subsidy of 20% of the cost of plant and machinery for other units.
The scheme is named Performance and Credit Rating.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the scheme is Credit.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance.
Any enterprise registered in India as a Micro or Small Enterprise is eligible to apply for the Performance and Credit Rating scheme.
For the Performance and Credit Rating scheme, the Quantum of Assistance is as follows: Reimbursement of fee through NSIC up to Rs. 50 lakh: 75% of the fee or Rs. 25,000 (whichever is less).
For the Performance and Credit Rating scheme, the Quantum of Assistance is as follows: Turnover of MSE above Rs. 50 lakh to 200 lakh: 75% of the fee or Rs. 30,000 (whichever is less).
For the Performance and Credit Rating scheme, the Quantum of Assistance is as follows: Turnover of MSE more than Rs. 200 lakh: 75% of the fee or Rs. 40,000 (whichever is less).
A link for details on the Performance and Credit Rating scheme is provided.
The scheme is named Entrepreneurship Development Programme.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of Science and Technology Energy.
The component of the scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of the scheme is not specified.
Training and R&D institutions are eligible to apply for the Entrepreneurship Development Programme.
The Quantum of Assistance for the Entrepreneurship Development Programme is Rs. 2 lakh.
A link for details on the Entrepreneurship Development Programme is provided.
The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology offers the Export Promotion of Capital Goods (EPCG) scheme.
The EPCG scheme falls under the 'Tax Exemptions' component and 'Finance' sub-component.
Manufacturer exporters, merchant exporters, and certified service providers are eligible applicants for the EPCG scheme.
The EPCG scheme provides zero duty to electronic products exporters.
The EPCG scheme offers a concessional 3% import duty on capital goods, including pre- and post-production equipment and software systems.
The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology offers the Production Linked Incentive Scheme for large-scale electronics manufacturing.
The Production Linked Incentive Scheme falls under the 'Technology' component and 'Finance Subsidy' sub-component.
Companies engaged in manufacturing target segments in India are eligible for the Production Linked Incentive Scheme.
The Production Linked Incentive Scheme provides an incentive of 4% to 6% on incremental sales (over the base year) of goods manufactured in India and covered under target segments.
The incentive under the Production Linked Incentive Scheme is extended to eligible companies for a period of five years.
The scheme is called 'Infrastructure for Agro-Processing Cluster'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of Food Processing Industries.
The component of the scheme is Technical Infrastructure.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance subsidy.
A single promoter can apply for this scheme.
The scheme provides a grant for Plant & Machinery and related technical civil works.
The grant is 35% of the eligible project cost in general areas.
The grant is 50% of the eligible project cost in hilly/ITDP and difficult areas.
The maximum grant per project is Rs. 10 crore.
If SC or/and ST promoters hold 100% stake in the Project Execution Agency (PEA), they are eligible for the grant.
The scheme is called 'Additional Grant for Apparel Manufacturing Units for Integrated Textile Park(SITP)'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of Textiles.
The component of the scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance.
Industry associations/entrepreneurial groups can apply for this scheme.
The scheme provides 40% of the proposed project cost as assistance.
The limit for assistance per park is Rs. 10 crore.
The Ministry of MSME offers the Interest Subsidy Eligibility Certificate (ISEC) scheme.
The ISEC scheme falls under the Finance component and the Credit sub-component.
Khadi institutions are eligible applicants for the ISEC scheme.
The ISEC scheme provides credit at a concessional interest rate of 4% per annum for working capital.
The Central Government, through KVIC, pays the difference between the actual lending rate and 4% to the lending banks for the ISEC scheme.
A link for more details on the ISEC scheme is available at https://msme.gov.in/node/1763#A3.
The Ministry of Food Processing Industries offers a scheme for Setting Up/Upgradation of Quality control/Food testing laboratories.
This scheme falls under the Technical Infrastructure component and the Finance Subsidy sub-component.

Eligible applicants for this scheme include Central/State Government and its organizations/universities (including Govt. owned deemed universities implementing agencies/private sector organizations/universities including deemed universities).
For Central/State Government and its organizations/universities, the scheme provides a grant-in-aid of the entire cost of laboratory equipment.

For Central/State Government and its organizations/universities, the scheme provides a grant-in-aid of 25% of the cost of technical civil work to house the equipment and furniture and fixtures associated with the equipment for general areas.

For Central/State Government and its organizations/universities, the scheme provides a grant-in-aid of 80% of the monthly emoluments of two technical staff for two years from the date of completion of the laboratory.
For other implementing agencies/private sector organizations/universities including deemed universities, the scheme provides a grant-in-aid of 50% of the cost of laboratory equipment.

For other implementing agencies/private sector organizations/universities including deemed universities, the scheme provides a grant-in-aid of 25% of the cost of technical civil work to house the Equipment and furniture and fixtures associated with the equipment for general areas.

When the Ministry establishes/sponsors food testing laboratories, there would be no ceiling to financial assistance, and the amount approved will be decided on a case-to-case basis with the approval of the Competent Authority.

A link for more details on the Setting Up/Upgradation of Quality control/Food testing laboratories scheme is available at https://mofpi.nic.in/Schemes/food-safety-qualityassuranceinfrastructure/settinggradation-quality-controlfood-testing-laboratory.
The Pharmaceutical Technology Upgradation Assistance Scheme (PTUAS) is offered by the Ministry of Chemicals & fertilizers (Department Of Pharmaceuticals).
The scheme's component is Technology.
The applicant for PTUAS is a Public Sector Financial institution identified by a bank, or a Commercial bank extending loans for pharma SMEs.
Eligible units under PTUAS can upgrade their manufacturing infrastructure to attain WHO-GMP norms.
PTUAS provides interest subvention against loans sanctioned by scheduled banks.
The upper sub-limit of interest subvention for PTUAS is restricted to 6% per annum for a period of 3 years.
The maximum loan eligible for PTUAS is Rs. 4 crore for the concerned SME.
The Scheme for Financial Support to Public Private Partnerships in Infrastructure (Viability Gap Funding Scheme) is administered by the Ministry of Finance Department of Economic affairs.
The scheme's component is Financial.
The applicant for the Viability Gap Funding Scheme is Central Ministries, State Governments, or Statutory Authorities (like Municipal Authorities and Councils) that own the underlying asset.

The Viability Gap Funding Scheme provides financial support in the form of grants, one-time or deferred, to infrastructure projects undertaken through Public Private Partnerships (PPPs) to make them commercially viable.
The Government of India provides Viability Gap Funding up to twenty percent of the total project cost, typically as a capital grant during project construction.
The Government or statutory entity owning the project can provide additional grants up to a further twenty percent of the total project cost.
The scheme is Smile Equipment Finance (SEF).
The Ministry/Department responsible for SEF is SIDBI.
The component of SEF is Credit.
The applicant for SEF must be an MSME that has existed for at least 3 years and has a satisfactory financial position.
Assistance for SEF includes investment in Plant & Machinery/MFAs/Need based civil construction.
The minimum loan amount for SEF is Rs. 10 Lakh.
There is a cap on the maximum loan amount for SEF.
The maximum repayment period for SEF is not more than 72 months, including moratorium.
A link for details on SEF is provided at https://sidbi.in/en/products.
The scheme is Plan (S&T), Coir Board (CSS of S&T of Coir Board).
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of this scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of this scheme is Finance Grant.
The applicants for this scheme are research institutions such as CCRI, Alleppey and CICT, Bangaluru.
Assistance for this scheme is a grant for R&D activities, infrastructure creation, and repairs (R&D only).
A link for details on this scheme is provided at http://coirboard.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/st.pdf.
The scheme is named Babasaheb Ambedkar Hastshilp Vikas Yojana.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of Textiles.
The component of the scheme is Skill Development Training.
The sub-component is Finance.
The applicants for this scheme are Apex cooperatives, corporations, state/central agencies.
The quantum of assistance involves support to handicrafts through social, technological, marketing, financial, and cluster-specific infrastructure-related interventions.
A link for more details is provided: https://www.drishtiias.com/daily-updates/daily-news-analysis/ambedkar-hastshilp-vikas-yojana-ahvy
The scheme is named Poultry Venture Capital Fund.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is NABARD.
The component of the scheme is Credit.
The sub-component is not specified.
The applicants for this scheme are Farmers, NGOs, cooperatives, SHGs, etc.
The quantum of assistance is 25% of outlay as back-ended capital subsidy, 10% margin, with the rest being a bank loan.
A link for more details is provided: http://animalhusbandryjammu.nic.in/Programmes%20&%20Schemes/PVCF.pdf

There is a scheme titled 'Science and Technology for Weaker Sections (STAWS)'.
The Ministry/Department for the STAWS scheme is Ministry of Science and Technology Energy.
The Scheme Name is Science and Technology for Weaker Sections (STAWS).
The Component for the STAWS scheme is Grant.
The Sub Component field is empty.
The Applicant for the STAWS scheme can be recognised schools, colleges, R&D institutions and universities.
The Quantum of Assistance for the STAWS scheme includes Equipment, salaries, consumables, internal travel, overheads, etc.
There is a link for details for the STAWS scheme.
The scheme is named Janshree Bima Yojana for Khadi Artisans.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The scheme falls under the Insurance component.
The sub-component is Finance.
The applicants for the scheme are Khadi Karigar (spinners and weavers) aged between 18 and 59 years.
Khadi Karigar applicants should be below or marginally above the poverty line.
For death due to natural causes, the assistance is Rs. 20,000.
For death due to accident, the assistance is Rs. 50,000.
For permanent disability (loss of two eyes or two limbs), the assistance is Rs. 50,000.
For partial disability (loss of one eye or one limb), the assistance is Rs. 25,000.
There is a free add-on benefit of a scholarship of Rs. 300 per quarter for children of Khadi Karigar.
The scholarship is for children studying in 9th to 12th standard.
The scholarship is subject to a maximum of 2 children per family.
The scheme is named Comprehensive Handlooms Cluster Development Scheme (CHCDS).
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of Textiles.
The scheme falls under the Infrastructure component.
The sub-component is Finance.
The applicants for the scheme are SPVs (Special Purpose Vehicles).
The maximum permissible Central cost for each cluster is Rs. 40.00 crore per cluster.
The duration for the assistance is 5 years.
The assistance is normally provided as a grant.
Part of the assistance can be considered as equity on a case-to-case basis for individual project/s or where it assists in financial closure.
The scheme is SIDBI TERM-Loan assistance for rooftop solar PV plants (STAR).
The Ministry/Department associated with the scheme is SIDBI.
The Scheme Name is SIDBI TERM-Loan assistance for rooftop solar PV plants (STAR).
The Component of the scheme is Credit.
The Sub Component is not specified.
For new customers, the applicant must have a vintage of 4 years.
For existing customers, the applicant must have a vintage of 2 years.
The applicant must have 2 years of cash profits.
The applicant must have a satisfactory repayment track record.
For new customers, the minimum IACR is 0.5% if there is no CGTMSE cover.
The proposed Solar rooftop capacity should not exceed the connected load.
Only On-site projects are eligible.
The scheme offers 100% finance with zero promoter's contribution.
A Fixed Deposit (FD) of 15% to 25% of the loan amount (interest bearing) is required.
The scheme offers attractive interest rates.
Credit Guarantee cover is available.
The loan documentation is simple.
Direct payment is made to the supplier.
Eligible expenditure includes the purchase of machinery/equipment.
Eligible expenditure includes need-based civil construction/renovation.
Eligible expenditure includes the acquisition of DG set/other MFAs (including testing equipment, dies & moulds etc.).
Eligible expenditure includes Margin money for working capital (MMWC).

MMWC can be used to execute sudden/specific/bulk orders which are self-liquidating in nature and are against a minimum BBB rated counter party or a state/central government department counter party with a track record in making timely payments.
Coverage includes Solar Panels/Equipment's (Including all accessories) from established suppliers, manufacturers, aggregators, etc., and Installation cost.
The Tenure for repayment is up to 5 years, including a moratorium of 3 to 6 months.
A link for details is provided at https://sidbi.in/en/products.
The scheme is Small and Medium Exporters Policy.
The Ministry/Department associated with the scheme is Ministry of Commerce and Industries.
The Scheme Name is Small and Medium Exporters Policy.
The Component of the scheme is Incentive.
The Sub Component of the scheme is Insurance Premium.
The applicant must be an exporter of goods and services with investment in plant and machinery as per MSMED Act.
The scheme provides a 12-month insurance policy for small and medium exporters.
The insurance policy offers 90% coverage.
The loss limit for the insurance policy is Rs. 10 lakh.
A link for details is provided at http://pahleindia.org/pdf/MSMEs-Policy-Brief.pdf.
The Ministry/Department is the Ministry of Food Processing Industries.
The scheme name is Creation of Backward and Forward Linkages.
The component of the scheme is Technical Infrastructure.
The sub-component is Finance.
A single promoter can apply for this scheme.
The scheme provides a grant for Plant & Machinery and related technical civil works.
The maximum admissible grant for each project is 35%.
Assistance to Farmer Producer Organizations is provided at 50%.
A link for scheme details is available at https://mofpi.nic.in/Schemes/scheme-creationbackward-and-forwardlinkages.

The survey form requires the Investment on Building in Rs.
The survey form requires the Major Activity of Unit, with options Manufacture, Trading, Services.
If the Major Activity is Services, the survey form requires the Major Activity under Services (Trading/Non-Trading).
The survey form requires the NIC 2 Digit Code.
The survey form requires the NIC 4 Digit Code.
The survey form requires the NIC 5 Digit Code.
The survey form requires the Male Employment count.
The survey form requires the Female Employment count.
The survey form requires the Others Employment count.
A success message 'Survey Details Saved Successfully' is displayed upon form submission.

The scheme is named 'Commercial Production Units of Organic Inputs'.
The Ministry/Department associated with this scheme is NABARD.
The component of the scheme is Credit.
The sub-component of the scheme is Subsidy.
The applicant for this scheme can be Individuals.
The quantum of assistance is a subsidy of 25% of the capital cost of the project.
A link for more details is provided: https://www.nabard.org/content.aspx?id=592.
The scheme is named 'Entrepreneurship Development Cell (EDC)'.
The Ministry/Department associated with this scheme is the Ministry of Science and Technology Energy.
The component of the scheme is Finance.
The sub-component of the scheme is not specified.
The applicants for this scheme are Universities, colleges, and institutions offering science and management courses.
The quantum of assistance involves financial assistance for setting up EDC and for meeting recurring expenditure.
A link for more details is provided: https://www.aicte-india.org/downloads/ENTREPRENEURSHIP%20DEVELOPMENT%20CELL.pdf.
The Small Exporters Policy (SEP) is a scheme offered by the Ministry of Commerce and Industries.
The component of the Small Exporters Policy (SEP) is Incentive.
The sub-component of the Small Exporters Policy (SEP) is Insurance Premium.
The applicant for the Small Exporters Policy (SEP) are exporters with a turnover below Rs. 5 crore.
The quantum of assistance for the Small Exporters Policy (SEP) is a 12-month insurance policy for small exporters.
Refinance for Small Road Transport Operators (SRTOS) is a scheme offered by SIDBI.
The component of Refinance for Small Road Transport Operators (SRTOS) is Credit.
The applicant for Refinance for Small Road Transport Operators (SRTOS) are small road transport operators.
The quantum of assistance for Refinance for Small Road Transport Operators (SRTOS) is Re-financing.
The Entrepreneurship Skill Development Programme (ESDP) is a scheme under the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the ESDP scheme is Entrepreneurship and Skill Development.
The sub-component of the ESDP scheme is Finance.
The ESDP programmes are conducted by MSME-DIs of the Ministry.
20% of the total targeted ESDPs are conducted exclusively for weaker sections of the society (SC/ST/women and PH).
A stipend of Rs. 500/- per month per candidate is provided under the Promotional Package for Micro, Small Enterprises (MSEs) for weaker sections.
No fee is charged from the candidates for the ESDP programmes.
The Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities is a scheme under the Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers (Department of Pharmaceuticals).
The component of the Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities scheme is Finance.
The project for Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities will be implemented through a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV).
Assistance for the Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities scheme is a one-time grant-in-aid released in phases for infrastructure and common facilities.
The maximum grant-in-aid for the Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities scheme is Rs. 20.00 crore per cluster or 70% of the project cost, whichever is less.

Assistance for administrative and other management support of the SPV during project implementation for the Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities scheme shall not exceed 5% of the grant-in-aid.

The scheme is the Integrated Skill Development Scheme.
The Ministry/Department is the Ministry of Textiles.
The Scheme Name is Integrated Skill Development Scheme.
The Component is Skill Development Training.
The Sub Component is Finance.
The Applicant is Individuals Enterprise/Unit.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) is GOI support would be 75% of the training cost or Rs.10,000.
There is a link for details to http://texmin.nic.in/sites/default/files/Incubation_Scheme_Guidelines_Final.pdf.
The scheme is called Modernisation of Abattoirs.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the Modernisation of Abattoirs scheme is the Ministry of Food Processing Industries.
The component of the Modernisation of Abattoirs scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of the Modernisation of Abattoirs scheme is Finance.
The applicants for the Modernisation of Abattoirs scheme are local bodies, PSUs, cooperatives, and government boards.
The quantum of assistance for the Modernisation of Abattoirs scheme is 50% of the cost of plant and machinery and technical civil works.
A link for details on the Modernisation of Abattoirs scheme is provided.
The scheme is called Coir Udyami Yojana.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the Coir Udyami Yojana is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the Coir Udyami Yojana is Credit.
The sub-component of the Coir Udyami Yojana is Finance.

The applicants for the Coir Udyami Yojana are individuals, companies, self-help groups, non-governmental organizations, institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860, production co-operative societies, joint liability groups, and charitable trusts.
The quantum of assistance for the Coir Udyami Yojana includes a maximum admissible project cost of 10 lakhs plus working capital, which shall not exceed 25% of the project cost.
The beneficiary's contribution for the Coir Udyami Yojana is 5% of the project cost.
The bank credit for the Coir Udyami Yojana is 55% of the project cost.
The rate of subsidy for the Coir Udyami Yojana is 40% of the project cost.
A link for details on the Coir Udyami Yojana is provided.
The scheme is the NABARD Warehousing scheme.
The Ministry/Department responsible for the NABARD Warehousing scheme is NABARD.
The component of the NABARD Warehousing scheme is Credit.

The applicant for the NABARD Warehousing scheme can be agencies owned/sponsored by State/Central Govt, Panchayati Raj institutions, cooperatives (and their Federations), Farmers Producers Organisations (FPOs), Federations of Farmers Collectives, Apex marketing boards, Private Companies, or Individual Entrepreneurs.

Loans under the NABARD Warehousing scheme will be provided for projects involving the creation of storage infrastructure with a minimum capacity of 5,000 MT for agricultural and allied produce, including the construction of warehouses, silos, and cold storage.
Priority will be given to projects proposed in the eastern and north-eastern regions and food grain deficit states under the NABARD Warehousing scheme.
A link for more details on the NABARD Warehousing scheme is available at https://www.nabard.org/content.aspx?id=571.
The scheme is the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA).
The Ministry/Department responsible for the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA) is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA) is Marketing.
The sub-component of the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA) is Finance Grant.
The applicant for the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA) must be Khadi institutions having a valid Khadi certificate and categorized as A+, A, B, or C.
Modified MDA (MMDA) shall be allowed at 30% on the prime cost of Khadi (cotton, silk, woolen) and Polyvastra under the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA).
A link for more details on the Market Promotion & Development Scheme (MPDA) is available at https://msme.gov.in/sites/default/files/Khadi_MPDA_Guidelines.pdf.
The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology offers the Electronics Hardware Technology Park (EHTP) scheme.
The EHTP scheme's component is Tax Exemptions.
The sub-component of the EHTP scheme is Finance.
Net foreign exchange earners are eligible applicants for the EHTP scheme.
The EHTP scheme provides 100% FDI, duty-free imports, and 100% tax exemption.
A link for details on the EHTP scheme is available at https://www.startupindia.gov.in/content/sih/en/government-schemes/hardware-technology-park-scheme.html.
The Ministry of Chemicals & fertilizers (Department Of Pharmaceuticals) offers the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme.
The Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme's component is Finance.
State Governments are the applicants for the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme.
The Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme proposes 3 parks with a total grant of 3000 crore.
The maximum grant-in-aid for one bulk drug park is limited to Rs 1000 crore over five years.
The grant-in-aid for the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme covers the cost of establishing Common Infrastructure Facilities (CIF) in the park.
The duration of the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme is from FY 2020-2021 to FY 2024-2025.
The grant-in-aid for the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme will be 70% of the project cost of the common infrastructure facilities (CIF).
Formulation units are not permitted in the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks.

A link for details on the Bulk Drug Industrial Parks scheme is available at https://pharmaceuticals.gov.in/sites/default/files/Guidelines%20of%20the%20Scheme%20Promotion%20of%20Bulk%20Drug%20Parks\_1.pdf.

The products include adhesives, transformer winding insulation gums, paint binders, thickeners, construction chemicals, architectural paints, etc.
The units enjoy GMP certification.
The units enjoy ISO 14001:2015 certification.
Reddy Sarveswara Rao hails from a family of agriculturists.
After completing his Commerce graduation in 1991, he worked in manufacturing, transport, and chit funds sectors.
Between 2007-2014, he was a partner in a corrugated boxes manufacturing industry.
Despite working for various enterprises thereafter, he aspired to be an entrepreneur.
In 2019, he established M/s Golden Packages.
He invested Rs. 21 lakhs for machinery in M/s Golden Packages.
He invested Rs. 5 lakhs for working capital in M/s Golden Packages.
Union Bank of India provided financial assistance of Rs. 12.6 lakhs for fixed capital investment.
Starting with just one client, Golden Packages has grown into a successful business.
Golden Packages manufactures corrugated boxes for ice cream manufacturers.
Golden Packages has expanded its client base from one to eight.
The enterprise applied for an investment subsidy.
Golden Packages was sanctioned Rs. 2.9 Lakhs under the IDP 2015-20 Policy.
Over the years, Golden Packages has carved a niche in the market.
Golden Packages showcases his entrepreneurial spirit and business acumen.
Mohammed Zareena is from Islampet locality of Bapatla town.
Mohammed Zareena is a traditional homemaker.
She used to assist her husband who runs a small cool drink shop at Bapatla Town.
The idea to manufacture soft drinks, soda and jeera water of their own brand struck her.
They approached the Canara Bank, Bapatla for financial assistance under the PMEGP Scheme.
The banker agreed to provide the assistance and asked them to contact DIC Officials, Bapatla.
An old house was taken on lease at Islampet and remodeled as per the specifications of the machinery supplier.
With the financial assistance coming from the banker, the machinery was installed.
The total project cost came up to Rs 25 Lakhs.
The unit is named M/s SJ Beverages.
M/s SJ Beverages manufactures Jeera water and Soda Water with a brand name of 'Star'.
The unit has an FSSAI license.
The unit has reached a fantastic turnover.
Star beverages were put on display on the Independence Day table in the year 2023.
Gyalam Ratnakumari wanted to empower women by providing employment and contributing to the community after completing her BA, B.Ed.
She approached the District Industries Centre, East Godavari.
She received handholding support for obtaining permissions from concerned departments under a Single Desk Portal.
With the DIC's support, her proposal for manufacturing PVC pipes through recycling plastic waste was quickly approved.
Under the PMEGP, she received incentives of Rs. 25 lakhs.
She received additional financial assistance from the Bank of Baroda, Rajahmundry.
Her own contribution to the project cost was Rs. 1.25 lakhs (5 percent of the project cost).
She launched her firm, M/s RK PVC Pipes in 2021.
Since then, she has firmly established the business by adhering to quality norms.
She has earned customer trust.
Today, her turnover has grown significantly.
She provides employment to many women.
Pangi Bhavani is a tribal woman.
Pangi Bhavani hails from Konthali Village, Hukumpet Mandal, Alluri Seetharamaraju District.
She always wanted to lend a helping hand to her husband, a carpenter by profession.
The Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) helped fulfill her dream to become her husband's business partner.
Bhavani wanted to establish a carpentry design unit.
She sought a financial assistance of Rs 5 lakh from Bank of Baroda, Hukumpet for the carpentry design unit.
The bank sanctioned the loan, seeing the viability of her proposal.
She got a subsidy of Rs. 1.75 lakhs under PMEGP on the loan.
She acquired the latest wood designing machinery with the loan amount.
The new machinery bolstered her business.
The new machinery enabled her to complete the work within time.
The new machinery increased her turnover drastically.
Bhavani earned a good reputation as a credit worthy entrepreneur because of her prompt repayment record.
MSR Leather Industry was founded by M. Seshagiri Rao in 1997.
MSR Leather Industry specializes in manufacturing a diverse range of leather accessories using 100 percent genuine leather.
Seshagiri Rao's dedication to excellence in his field has earned him numerous awards from MSMEs and PSUs over the years.
The company owns international brands like Lee Leather, Go Leather, and Leather Time.
MSR Leather Industry supplies its products to major malls across the country.
MSR Leather Industry has established a strong presence in global markets.
This success has positioned MSR Leather Industry as a key player in the global leather accessories market.
MSR Leather Industry has significantly contributed to the local economy by providing employment opportunities.
The company's growth is evidenced by a notable increase in turnover.
Vision Biotech was established in 2017 at APIIC, IP, Gollapuram, Hindupur, Sri Sathya Sai District.
The sole aim of Vision Biotech is to offer quality life-saving drugs, herbal extracts, and cosmetic intermediates to renowned companies.
The company was promoted by its Managing Director, Muniraj K.
Muniraj K holds a post-graduate degree in chemistry.
Muniraj K has approximately 25 years of experience in various pharmaceutical industries based in Bangalore.
He has gained vast knowledge and experience regarding the importance of quality drugs and cosmetic products needed in our daily lives.
Cosmetic products such as sunscreen lotions, anti-dandruff agents, hair growth stimulating products, and skin whitening agents enjoy extensive demand in the market.
These ingredients are supplied to famous companies such as Procter & Gamble, Johnson & Johnson, Godrej, Hindustan Unilever, and Himalaya Wellness, among others.
The organization is dedicated to delivering quality products to its valuable customers.
The organization employs modern techniques to continually improve the quality standards stipulated by reputed companies.
Durga Prasanna Kumar gained valuable experience working as a sales representative in a private marketing company after completing his education in 2010.
In 2018, driven by his entrepreneurial spirit, he ventured into the food industry.
He launched M/s. Indian Groceries Company, focusing on spice powder manufacturing in Vizianagaram District.
Recognizing the potential of his vision, he applied for support under the PMEGP scheme through the District Industries Centre, Vizianagaram.
With assistance from the Union Bank of India, Durga Prasanna Kumar secured a loan of Rs. 25 lakhs.
He started his processing unit in 2019.
The initial year posed challenges.
By the financial year 2023-24, his perseverance paid off as the company's turnover soared to over Rs. 2.4 crores.
Utilizing the margin money from his first loan, he successfully expanded operations.
He further strengthened his market presence.
Continuing to fuel growth, he obtained a second loan under the PMEGP scheme.
Committed to contributing to his community, he prioritizes providing employment opportunities to deserving young individuals.
N. Venkata Rao launched M/s Venkata Durga Ramaraju Modern Rice & Flour Mill.
He made an initial personal investment of Rs. 20 lakh in the year 2002.
In 2005, he decided to expand the business.
He invested an additional Rs. 40 lakhs to improve productivity.
This second investment boosted production capacity to meet customer needs.
He adopted a farmer-friendly approach by purchasing raw materials directly from local farmers.
He eliminated middlemen by purchasing raw materials directly from local farmers.
This ensured that farmers received fair prices for their produce.
This significantly increased farmers' profits.
This contributed to the region's economic development.
The rice mill expanded its market reach, selling rice to neighboring districts.
The increased production capacity and market expansion have led to a substantial rise in the company's turnover.
The business has generated numerous employment opportunities for local residents.
P. Kowsar Jabeen is a first-generation entrepreneur.
P. Kowsar Jabeen is the proprietor of M/s Swift Abrasives.
With the objective of contributing to society, she launched her unit in 2018.
Within no time, the unit attained an annual production capacity of 300,000 tools.
India is one of the few countries in the world processing a wide spectrum of dimensional stones such as granite, marble, sandstone, limestone, and quartz.
India holds a market share of over 10% in dimensional stones.
India is the top exporter of sandstones.
In polishing units, abrasive materials are used for polishing with water and oil as coolants.
These abrasives undergo wear and tear and need periodic replacement in polishing machines.
Swift Abrasives is the only unit manufacturing abrasives in the area.
Swift Abrasives is running successfully.
The Ministry of Food Processing Industries offers the Scheme for Creation/Expansion of Food Processing & Preservation Capacities.
The scheme's component is Technical Infrastructure.
The scheme's sub-component is Finance.
A single promoter can apply for the scheme.
The quantum of assistance is a grant for Plant & Machinery and related technical civil works.
The grant is 35% of the eligible project cost, with a maximum of Rs. 5 Crore for the General Area.
The Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers (Department of Pharmaceuticals) has a Scheme for Promotion of Medical Device Parks.
This scheme is a Finance component, with no specific Sub Component listed.
The Applicant for this scheme is the State Government.
Financial assistance under the Scheme is for the creation of common infrastructure facilities in four Medical Device Parks proposed by State Governments and selected under the scheme.
The maximum assistance for one Medical Device Park is limited to Rs. 100 crore.
Financial assistance to a selected Medical Device Park is 70% of the project cost of common infrastructure facilities.
For North Eastern States and Hilly States, financial assistance is 90% of the project cost.
The Ministry of Textiles has a Human Resource Development (HRD) scheme.
This scheme is a Grant component, with Finance as the Sub Component.
The Applicant for the HRD scheme includes recognized vocational training institutions, ITIs, and polytechnics.
The Quantum of Assistance for the HRD scheme includes capital grant and training grant, with a limit of Rs. 1.45 crore for five years.
The HRD scheme provides 100% grant-in-aid.
A link for details on the Medical Device Parks scheme is provided: https://pharmaceuticals.gov.in/sites/default/files/Gazette%20notification%20of%20Medical%20Device%20schemes.pdf
A link for details on the Human Resource Development scheme is provided: https://www.meity.gov.in/human-resource-development
The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology is associated with the Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme.
The Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme is a public scheme.
The component of the Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme is Infrastructure.
The sub-component of the Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme is Finance Subsidy.

The applicants for the Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme can be the State Government, State Implementing Agency (SIA), Central Public Sector Unit (CPSU), State Public Sector Unit (SPSU), or Industrial Corridor Development Corporation (ICDC) such as DMICDC.
For an EMC Project, financial assistance is restricted to 50% of the project cost, with a ceiling of Rs. 70 crores for every 100 acres of land.
For larger areas under the EMC Project, a pro-rata ceiling would apply, not exceeding Rs. 350 crore per project.
For Common Facility Centers (CFCs) under the Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme, financial assistance is restricted to 75% of the project cost, with a ceiling of Rs. 75 crores.
A link for details on the Electronics Manufacturing Clusters Scheme is provided, pointing to a PDF document.
The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology is associated with the Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme.
The Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme is a public scheme.
The component of the Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme is Tax Exemptions.
The sub-component of the Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme is Finance.
Medium and large industries are eligible applicants for the Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme.
The Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme offers tax and duty exemptions of varying definitions and single-window clearance.
A link for details on the Special Economic Zone (SEZ) scheme is provided, pointing to a PDF document.
The language of the document is English.
There is a navigation menu with links to Home, RAMP, Udyam Registration, VDP, Green Packaging, ESDP, BDS, ZED, IPR, RBSM, and TReDS.
TReDS is an RBI-regulated digital platform.
TReDS enables MSMEs to convert their trade receivables into immediate liquidity by auctioning them to multiple financiers.
Delayed payments are a critical challenge for MSMEs, impacting their cash flow and growth potential.

The Government of Andhra Pradesh has directed all State Public Sector Undertakings, Municipal Corporations, and State-level Autonomous Bodies/Societies to register on any of the three RBI-approved TReDS platforms: RXIL, M1xchange, and Invoicemart.
This intervention aims to accelerate MSME growth, enhance liquidity, and ensure transparent and timely payments for suppliers of goods and services across the state.
Unregistered MSMEs can attend the workshop.
New Entrepreneurs can attend the workshop.
SHGs can attend the workshop.
MSMEs, CPSEs/SPSEs, Government Departments, Large Industries, Municipal Corporations/State Level Autonomous Bodies/Societies can attend the workshop.
Attending the workshop offers the best discount rate due to the participation of multiple financiers in the auction.
Attending the workshop leads to efficient capital deployment.
Attending the workshop ensures timely receipt of funds.
Attending the workshop results in cost and paperwork reduction.
Attending the workshop is helpful in business growth due to improved liquidity.
Attending the workshop ensures compliance with MSMED Act, 2006.
Attending the workshop facilitates efficient cash flow management.
Attending the workshop leads to efficient payment cycles.
Attending the workshop provides access to a wider market.
Attending the workshop assures qualified instruments.
Attending the workshop aids in risk management.
Attending the workshop reduces operational cost.

The introduction section covers the overview of TReDS and its significance, TReDS platforms and their benefits for MSMEs, CPSEs eligibility criteria, registration process, and case studies/success stories.
The user interface section includes a guided tour of the TReDS platform and dashboard features for tracking payments and managing invoices.
The making and organizing bills section covers creating and uploading invoices, submitting bills for discounting, and managing the invoice lifecycle.
The comprehending the discounting procedure section explains how rebates are calculated, the bid process & MSME participation, and understanding settlement timelines.
The documentation and compliance section covers RBI regulatory compliance and essential transaction records.
The security and risk management section discusses identifying risks in invoice discounting, data security measures, and fraud prevention mechanisms.
The business process integration ERP section covers integration with TReDS, best practices for daily use, and support and troubleshooting.

The Ministry/Department for the Credit Linked Capital Subsidy for Technology Upgradation scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The scheme name is Credit Linked Capital Subsidy for Technology Upgradation.
The component of the scheme is Technology.
The sub-component of the scheme is Credit linked capital Subsidy.
The applicant for the scheme is Micro and Small Enterprises.
The quantum of assistance for the scheme is 15% up front capital subsidy.
A link for details of the Credit Linked Capital Subsidy for Technology Upgradation scheme is provided.
The Ministry/Department for the Micro & Small Enterprises Cluster Development (MSE-CDP) scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name is Micro & Small Enterprises Cluster Development (MSE-CDP).
The Component of the MSE-CDP scheme is Technology.
The Sub Component of the MSE-CDP scheme is Finance Grant.
The Applicant for the MSE-CDP scheme can be Clusters or Industrial associations/Consortia.
For hard interventions like setting up of CFCs under MSE-CDP, the maximum eligible project cost is Rs. 15 crore.
The GoI contribution for setting up of CFCs under MSE-CDP is 70% of the project cost.
For special category States and for clusters with more than 50% women/micro/village/SC/ST units, the GoI contribution for setting up of CFCs under MSE-CDP is 90%.
For infrastructure development in new/existing industrial estates/areas under MSE-CDP, the maximum eligible project cost is Rs. 10 crore.
The GoI contribution for infrastructure development under MSE-CDP is 60% of the project cost.
For special category States and for clusters with more than 50% women/micro/SC/ST units, the GoI contribution for infrastructure development under MSE-CDP is 80%.
The Ministry/Department for the Comprehensive scheme for development of Knitting and knitwear sector under Powertex India is the Ministry of Textiles.
The Scheme Name is Comprehensive scheme for development of Knitting and knitwear sector under Powertex India.
The Component of this scheme is Skill Training and Capacity Building Technical infrastructure.
The Sub Component of this scheme is Finance Subsidy.
The Applicant for this scheme can be MSME Units/Stakeholders of the Cluster.
Financial assistance up to Rs. 200 lakhs per Center will be provided towards purchase of testing equipment and machineries required for training for the KSCs under this scheme.
The testing equipments and machineries required for training can be decided by the stakeholders of the clusters as per their requirement within the overall cap of Rs. 200 lakh.
Any additional equipment required for KSCs would be purchased by the stakeholders at their own cost.
The scheme is named Swarozgar Credit Card.
The Ministry/Department associated with the Swarozgar Credit Card scheme is NABARD.
The component of the Swarozgar Credit Card scheme is Credit.
The applicants for the Swarozgar Credit Card scheme include small artisans, handloom weavers, other self-employed persons, micro-entrepreneurs, and Self-Help Groups (SHGs).
The Quantum of Assistance for the Swarozgar Credit Card scheme covers working capital, including consumption needs and/or block capital.
The scheme is named Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP).
The Ministry/Department associated with the Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP) is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP) is Marketing.
The sub-component of the Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP) is Finance.

The applicants for the Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP) include Apex Co-operative Societies, Central Co-operative Societies, Primary Co-operative Societies, Public Sector Enterprises, franchisees appointed by the Coir Board in the coir industry, and the Showroom and Sales Depots/Hindustan Coir of the Coir Board.
The Quantum of Assistance for the Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP) is financial assistance granted at the rate of 10% of their average annual sales turnover of coir products.

The Board for the Domestic Market Promotion Scheme (DMP) will follow the General Financial Rules (GFR) and other relevant rules and regulations of the Government of India for the purchase of goods and services required for publicity.
The Ministry of MSME offers a scheme called Entrepreneurial and Managerial Development of SMEs through Incubators.
This scheme has a component named Entrepreneurship development Technology.
The sub-component is Finance Grant.
Individuals or MSMEs with innovative ideas ready for commercialization can apply to host institutions like IITs, NITs, technical colleges, or research institutes for fund support.
The scheme provides funding support for setting up 'Business Incubators (BI)'.
The cost per incubatee/idea can range from Rs. 4 to 8 lakh.
There is an overall ceiling of Rs. 62.5 lakh for each BI.
Upgradation of infrastructure is supported with Rs. 2.50 lakh.
Orientation/training is supported with Rs. 1.28 lakh.
Administrative expenses are supported with Rs. 0.22 lakh.
The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy has a scheme for the Development of Solar Parks and Ultra Mega Solar Power Projects.
This scheme's component is Finance.
The scheme is open to Project Developers and Investors.
The Ministry provides Central Financial Assistance (CFA) of up to Rs. 25 lakh per solar park for the preparation of Detailed Project Reports (DPR).
Additionally, CFA of up to Rs. 20.00 lakh per MW or 30% of the project cost (including Grid-connectivity cost, whichever is lower) is provided upon achieving prescribed milestones.
The CFA of Rs. 20 Lakh/MW is divided on a 60:40 basis for internal infrastructure development of solar parks (to SPPD) and external transmission system development (to CTU/STU).
Rs. 12 lakh per MW or 30% of the project cost (whichever is lower) is provided to SPPDs for internal infrastructure development if the solar parks are developed.
Rs. 8 lakh per MW or 30% of the project cost (whichever is lower) is provided to CTU or STU for the development of external transmission systems.
This CFA pattern applies to Mode 1 to Mode 5.
Mode 6 is for private entrepreneurs without CFA.
Under Mode 7, the entire CFA of Rs. 20 Lakh/MW is exclusively for External Transmission Infrastructure Systems.
The Ministry/Department for the Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG) is the Ministry of Science and Technology Energy.
The Scheme Name for the Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG) is Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG).
The Component for the Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG) is Grant.
The Applicant for the Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG) is Incubates/recognised bio-tech start-ups.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG) is Up to Rs.50 lakh.
The Link for Detail for the Bio-Technology Ignition Grant (BIG) is https://www.birac.nic.in/big.php.
The Ministry/Department for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs is Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs is Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs.
The Component for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs is Technology.
The Sub Component for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs is Finance Grant.

The Applicant for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes Expert organisations like PCRA, BEE, TERI, IITs, NITs, etc., State Govt. agencies like MITCON, GEDA, etc., Cluster/industry based associations of MSMEs, NGOs, and Technical Institutions.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes funding support of up to 75% for awareness programmes, subject to a maximum of Rs.75,000 per programme.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes implementation of energy efficient technologies in MSME units with 75% of actual expenditure for cluster level energy audit and preparation of model DPR.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes setting up of Carbon Credit Aggregation Centres with 50% of actual expenditure subject to a maximum of Rs.1.5 lakh per DPR towards preparation of subsequent detailed project reports for individual MSMEs on EET projects.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes encouraging MSMEs to acquire product certification/licenses from National/International bodies with 75% of the actual expenditure, subject to a maximum of Rs 1.5 lakh.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes 25% of the project cost as subsidy by Government of India, with the balance amount to be funded through loan from SIDBI/banks/financial Institutions, and MSMEs are required to make the minimum contribution as required by the funding agency.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs includes 75% subsidy towards licensing of products to national/international standards, with a ceiling of Rs 1.5 lakh for obtaining product licensing/marking to National standards and Rs 2 lakhs for International standards.
The Link for Detail for Technology and Quality Upgradation Support to MSMEs is http://www.dcmsme.gov.in/schemes/TEQUPDetail.htm.
The scheme is named SIDBI Assistance to facilitate emergency response against Corona Virus (SAFEPLUS).
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is SIDBI.
The component of the scheme is Credit.
The sub-component is not specified.
For new bank customers, applicants must have at least two years of cash profits and their account should not be in SMA1/2 category.
For existing bank customers, applicants must have cash profit in the last audited balance sheet and their account should not be in SMA1/2 category.
The eligible expenditure is to meet emergency/additional working capital requirements for all existing MSMEs.
MSMEs must have confirmed orders from Central/State Government/Government agencies nominated for the purpose.
The products or services must be directly related to fighting Corona Virus (Covid-19).
The maximum loan amount is up to Rs. 100 Lakh, linked to the turnover of the unit.
The interest rate is 5% per annum fixed on a reducing balance basis.
The scheme is the National Mission on Food Processing (NMFP).
The Ministry/Department responsible for the scheme is the Ministry of Food Processing Industries.
The component of the scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance.
The applicant for the scheme is Food processing industries.
The assistance is provided to all states in the ratio of 75:25 between GoI and states.
In the North Eastern Region (NER), the ratio is 90:10.
In Union Territories (UTs), the grant is 100%.
The Ministry/Department for the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name for the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme is Performance and Credit Rating Scheme.
The Component for the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme is Credit.
The Sub Component for the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme is Finance.
The Applicant for the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme is Small and medium enterprises.
For the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme, 75% of the rating fee is reimbursed, with a maximum of Rs. 25,000, for enterprises with a turnover up to Rs. 50 lakh.
For the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme, 75% of the rating fee is reimbursed, with a maximum of Rs. 30,000, for enterprises with a turnover above Rs. 50 lakh to Rs. 2 crore.
For the Performance and Credit Rating Scheme, 75% of the rating fee is reimbursed, with a maximum of Rs. 40,000, for enterprises with a turnover above Rs. 2 crore.
The Ministry/Department for the 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals) is the Ministry of Mines.
The Scheme Name for the 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals) is 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals).
The Component for the 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals) is Grant.
The Applicant for the 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals) can be firms, associations, or companies participating in the bid process.
The period of grant of lease/contract for the 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals) may vary from 7-10 years.
Financial assistance for the 'Scheme of Mining' for the Mining of Construction Material (Minor Minerals) would be provided from the 'Aravalli Rehabilitation Fund (ARF)'.
The ARF is established to fund schemes considered necessary for the protection and preservation of the Aravalli ranges in the state of Haryana.

The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology offers a scheme called Deemed Exports.
The Deemed Exports scheme falls under the 'Tax Exemptions' component and 'Finance' sub-component.
All licensed exporters are eligible to apply for the Deemed Exports scheme.
The Deemed Exports scheme provides exemption of terminal excise duty against ICB, or refund.
A detailed document for the Deemed Exports scheme can be found at https://www.meity.gov.in/writereaddata/files/DeemedExportScheme(1).pdf.
The Ministry of MSME offers a scheme called Lean Manufacturing Competitiveness for MSMEs.
The Lean Manufacturing Competitiveness for MSMEs scheme falls under the 'Technology' component and 'Finance' sub-component.

Industry associations or groups of approximately 10 MSME units, qualifying under the MSMEDevelopment Act, 2006 and willing to form an SPV (Mini Cluster), are eligible to apply for the Lean Manufacturing Competitiveness for MSMEs scheme.

The Lean Manufacturing Competitiveness for MSMEs scheme provides financial support from the Government of India up to a maximum of 80% of the consultant fees for each Mini Cluster, with the remaining 20% to be borne by the beneficiary MSME units.
A detailed document for the Lean Manufacturing Competitiveness for MSMEs scheme can be found at https://msme.gov.in/sites/default/files/guidelines%20lean.pdf.
The scheme is for the Establishment/Modernisation of Rural Slaughter Houses.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is NABARD.
The scheme's component is Credit.
The scheme's sub-component is Subsidy.
The eligible applicants for this scheme are Organisations, partnership firms, NGOs and entrepreneurs.
The quantum of assistance is 50% of the total financial outlay as capital subsidy.
The scheme is EES Filing and Information.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of Corporate Affairs.
The scheme's component is Assistance.
The eligible applicants for this scheme are Defunct companies.
The quantum of assistance is for filing loan application and providing security/guarantee.
The Ministry/Department for the ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name for the ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement scheme is ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement.
The Component for the ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement scheme is Finance.
The Sub Component for the ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement scheme is Incentive.
The Applicant for the ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement scheme is MSE.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the ISO 9000/ISO 14001 Certification Reimbursement scheme is reimbursement of charges for acquiring ISO-9000/ISO-14001/HACCP certification to the extent of 75% of expenditure subject to a maximum of Rs.75,000 in each case.
The Ministry/Department for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme is the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy.

The Scheme Name for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme is Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy.
The Component for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme is Grant.
The Sub Component for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme is Finance.

The Applicant for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme includes Research and Development Institutions, Academic Institutions, Autonomous Institutions, Departments/Agencies/PSUs, States/UTs Government, Panchayats, Community based and organisations of civil societies.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme states that financial assistance for RDD&D projects that involve partnership with industry/civil society organizations should normally be restricted to 50% of the project cost.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme also states that for any proposal from Universities, Government Research Institutions, Private Educational Institutions, etc., the Ministry may provide up to 100% funding, depending on project priority.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the Research, Design, Development, Demonstration (RDD&D) and Manufacture of New and Renewable Energy scheme requires Private Educational Institutions, especially engineering colleges, to furnish a declaration that they do not levy and collect donations for admissions from students while applying for R & D grants.
The Ministry/Department for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) is the Ministry of Science and Technology Energy.
The Scheme Name for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) is Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP).
The Component for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) is Finance.
The Sub Component for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) is not specified.
The Applicant for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) is Academia and collaborating companies.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) depends on the merit of the case.

A link for detail for the Bio-Technology Industry Research Assistance Programme (BIRAP) is provided at https://biotech.co.in/en/pilot-biotechnology-industry-research-development-assistance-programme-birap-public-private.
The Ministry/Department for International Cooperation is the Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name for International Cooperation is International Cooperation.
The Component for International Cooperation is Marketing.
The Sub Component for International Cooperation is Finance.
The Applicant for International Cooperation is Government Institutions and Registered Industry Associations.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for International Cooperation for International Events held in foreign countries is Rs. 25.00 lakh per event.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for International Cooperation for International Events held in India is Rs. 5.00 lakh per event for participation in International exhibitions/trade fairs.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for International Cooperation for International Events held in India is Rs. 4.50 lakh for organization of International Conferences/Seminars.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for Holding/organising International conferences/ seminars/ workshops in India by Ministry of MSME or organizations under it involves seeking budget approval from the Minister of MSME after consulting IFW by the Administrative Wing of the Ministry of MSME for each event.
A link for detail for International Cooperation is provided at https://msme.gov.in/sites/default/files/IC-Scheme-Guidelines-June-2018.pdf.
The Ministry/Department for the Scheme of Surveys, Studies and Policy Research is the Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name is Scheme of Surveys, Studies and Policy Research.
The Component for this scheme is Research and Development.
The Sub Component is Finance.
The Applicant for this scheme is concerned organizations/Divisions under Ministry of MSME.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) is as decided by the committee on the proposals received. Refer to link for details.
The Link for Detail for the Scheme of Surveys, Studies and Policy Research is https://msme.gov.in/sites/default/files/REVISED-GUIDELINES-OF-SCHEM-OF-SURVEY.pdf.
The Ministry/Department for the Research & Development, Quality Assurance, Codex and Promotional Activities scheme is the Ministry of Food Processing Industries.
The Scheme Name is Research & Development, Quality Assurance, Codex and Promotional Activities.
The Component for this scheme is Grant.
The Sub Component is Finance.
The Applicant for this scheme is Central/State Government and its organisations, universities, etc.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for this scheme is Grant-in-aid of entire cost of lab equipment, 25% cost of technical civil works to house equipments.

The Link for Detail for the Research & Development, Quality Assurance, Codex and Promotional Activities scheme is https://mofpi.nic.in/Schemes/human-resources-andinstitutions/researchdevelopment-foodprocessing-sector.
The Ministry of Food Processing Industries offers a Scheme for Cold chain, Value Addition and Preservation Infrastructure.
This scheme has a component of Technical Infrastructure.
Within Technical Infrastructure, there is a Sub Component called Finance.
A single promoter can apply for this scheme.
The scheme provides a grant for Plant & Machinery and related technical civil works.
Financial assistance is provided as a grant-in-aid.
The grant is 35% of the total cost of plant and machinery and technical civil works in General areas.
The grant is 50% of the total cost of plant and machinery and technical civil works in General areas.
The maximum financial assistance is Rs. 10 Crore.
A link for more details is available at https://mofpi.nic.in/Schemes/cold-chain.
The Ministry of Textiles offers the Comprehensive handicrafts cluster development scheme (CHCDS).
This scheme has a component of Technical Infrastructure.
Within Technical Infrastructure, there is a Sub Component called Technology Upgradation/FinanceSubsidy.
SPVs are eligible applicants for this scheme.
Funds up to 3% (maximum) of the project cost are earmarked for establishing baseline data/DPR.
Funds will be released in three installments.
The first installment is 40% as advance upon SPV acquiring land.
The second installment is another 40% upon utilization of 2/3 of the first installment.
The balance amount is released as the third and final installment as reimbursement.
A link for more details is available at http://texmin.nic.in/sites/default/files/11d_Guidelines_of_development_of_mega_cluster_scheme_Handicrafts_nmcc_cs_20090312.pdf.
The scheme is called Welfare Measures (Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY)).
The Ministry/Department responsible is the Ministry of MSME.
The Component is Welfare.
The Sub Component is Insurance.
The applicants for the scheme are coir workers.

Coir workers can be self-employed, employed under SFURTI coir clusters, engaged in units registered with the Coir Board, or come under the fold of the Welfare Fund Board, PSUs, Corporations, Federations, Cooperative Societies, etc.
The assistance provided is accident insurance coverage for death or disability due to accidents for coir workers.
A link for more details is provided: https://msme.gov.in/sites/default/files/Revised_Operation_Guidelines_of_CVY.pdf
The scheme is called Software Technology Parks of India (STPI).
The Ministry/Department responsible is the Ministry of Communication and Information Technology.
The Component is Tax Exemptions.
The Sub Component is Finance.
The applicants for the scheme are Software companies.
The assistance provided is tax and duty exemptions.
A link for more details is provided: https://www.meity.gov.in/writereaddata/files/NIT_0.pdf
The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology offers the Export Promotion Capital Goods Scheme.
The Export Promotion Capital Goods Scheme falls under the Finance component and the Concession sub-component.
Exporters are eligible to apply for the Export Promotion Capital Goods Scheme.
The Export Promotion Capital Goods Scheme allows the import of capital goods at a 3% customs duty.
These capital goods are for pre-production, production, and post-production activities.
Imported capital goods can include CKD/SKD thereof and computer software systems.
There is an export obligation equivalent to 8 times the duty saved on imported capital goods.
This export obligation must be fulfilled within 8 years from the authorization issue date.
Spares (including refurbished/reconditioned spares), tools, jigs, fixtures, and dies are included as capital goods.
Second-hand capital goods can also be imported under the EPCG Scheme without any age restriction.
A link for more details on the Export Promotion Capital Goods Scheme is provided.
SIDBI offers the Rehabilitation of Sick Industrial Units scheme.
The Rehabilitation of Sick Industrial Units scheme falls under the Credit component.
Potentially viable MSEs, cottage, and village units are eligible applicants for the Rehabilitation of Sick Industrial Units scheme.
The scheme provides assistance for the rehabilitation of potentially viable sick MSEs.
A link for more details on the Rehabilitation of Sick Industrial Units scheme is provided.
The Chemicals Promotion Development Scheme is offered by the Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers (Department of Pharmaceuticals).
The scheme's component is Research and Development, with a sub-component of Finance Subsidy.
Industries Associations/Group of Entrepreneurs and SPVs (Special Purpose Vehicle) are eligible applicants for the Chemicals Promotion Development Scheme.
Financial support for the Chemicals Promotion Development Scheme will not exceed 50% of the cost or Rs. 7.50 lakhs, whichever is lower, per study/report for Buildings, Plants, and Machineries.
The Yarn Supply Scheme is offered by the Ministry of Textiles.
The scheme's component is Finance, with a sub-component of Finance Subsidy.
Individual weavers, Self Help Groups, Joint Liability Groups, and cooperative societies are eligible applicants for the Yarn Supply Scheme.
Raw material such as Cotton, Domestic Silk, Woolen, and Linen yarn required for the production of handloom items will be covered under the 10% price subsidy for the Yarn Supply Scheme.
The SIDBI Trader Finance Scheme (STFS) is a credit component scheme.
The sub-component of STFS is for working capital requirement and need-based capital expenditure.
Applicants for STFS are MSME Retailers/Wholesalers who have been in existence for at least 3 years and have a satisfactory financial position.
The drop in sales turnover for STFS applicants should not exceed 10% year-on-year in the last 2 years.
The eligible expenditure for STFS includes any business-related expenditure, such as working capital requirements and need-based capital expenditure (including renovation of existing owned shops).
Non-business-related commodity trading of metals, gems & jewellery, etc., are excluded from eligible expenditure for STFS.
The assistance for STFS ranges from a minimum of Rs. 10 lakh to a maximum of Rs. 1 crore.
The total assistance from SIDBI for working capital and capex under STFS cannot exceed the maximum ceiling of Rs. 1 crore.
The repayment period for STFS depends on cash flow and business size, with a maximum repayment period of 60 months, including moratorium.
The Procurement and Marketing Support Scheme (P&MS) is a marketing component scheme under the Ministry of MSME.
The sub-component of P&MS is finance.
Individual Manufacturing/Service MSEs are eligible applicants for the P&MS scheme.
Under P&MS, there is a subsidy on space rent charges: 80% for the General Category and 100% for SC/ST Women/Aspirational Districts.
Contingency expenditure under P&MS is covered at 100%, subject to a maximum of Rs. 25,000 or the actual amount, whichever is less.
The maximum budgetary support for P&MS, including contingency expenditure, is Rs. 1.5 lakhs (including taxes) or actual, whichever is less, for Metro & A-class cities.
The maximum budgetary support for P&MS, including contingency expenditure, is Rs. 1 lakh (including taxes) or actual, whichever is less, for B-class cities.
The scheme is called 'Design Clinic for Design Expertise to MSMEs'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the scheme is Technology.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance Grant.

The applicants for this scheme can be expert agencies (Industry Associations, Technical Institutions or other appropriate bodies) for conducting seminars and workshops for MSMEs or groups of MSMEs, Academic Institutes/design companies/design consultants, etc., applying as co-applicants along with a designated MSME.
The quantum of assistance includes funding support of Rs. 60,000 per seminar and 75% subject to a maximum of Rs. 3.75 lakhs per workshop.
The scheme aims to facilitate MSMEs to develop new design strategies and/or design-related products and services through project interventions and consultancy.
The Government of India's contribution is 75% for micro and 60% for SMEs for projects ranging from Rs. 15 lakh to Rs. 40 lakh.
A link for more details is provided at http://www.dcmsme.gov.in/schemes/DesignClinic.htm.
The scheme is called 'Establishing Poultry Estates and Mother Units for Rural Backyard Poultry'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is NABARD.
The component of the scheme is Credit.
The sub-component is not specified.
The applicant for this scheme can be individuals.
The quantum of assistance for a unit of 1,500 chicks per batch is Rs. 1.36 lakh.
A link for more details is provided at http://www.kiran.nic.in/schemes.html.
The Ministry/Department for the Science & Engineering Research Council (SERC) scheme is the Ministry of Science and Technology Energy.
The Scheme Name is Science & Engineering Research Council (SERC).
The Component for the SERC scheme is Finance.
The Sub Component for the SERC scheme is not specified.
Applicants for the SERC scheme can be Scientists, academic, industrial and R&D organisations.
The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the SERC scheme includes salaries, equipment, travel, and overheads.
A link for detail on the SERC scheme is provided at http://www.facweb.iitkgp.ac.in/~skbarai/Serc.pdf.
The Ministry/Department for the Development of Production Infrastructure (DPI) Scheme-coir is the Ministry of MSME.
The Scheme Name is Development of Production Infrastructure (DPI) Scheme-coir.
The Component for the DPI Scheme-coir is Infrastructure.
The Sub Component for the DPI Scheme-coir is Finance.
The Applicant for the DPI Scheme-coir is existing coir production units.

The Quantum of Assistance (in Brief) for the DPI Scheme-coir includes financial assistance to coir production units at 25% of the cost of equipment, subject to a maximum of Rs. 6 lakhs for setting up a defibering unit, Rs. 4 lakhs for an automatic spinning unit, and Rs. 5 lakhs for others including coir pith.
For composite or multiple units, the maximum ceiling of financial assistance for the DPI Scheme-coir is Rs. 9 lakhs.
The DPI Scheme-coir also provides financial assistance up to Rs. 2 lakhs for modernization/renovation of existing units.
A link for detail on the DPI Scheme-coir is provided at https://www.coirboard.gov.in/.
The scheme is called Design and Technology Upgradation.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of Textiles.
The component of the scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance.
The applicants for this scheme are State/Central handicrafts corporations and apex cooperative societies.
The Quantum of Assistance for training activities is 100% grant-in-aid.
The Quantum of Assistance for tools is 100% with a limit of Rs. 10,000 per kit per person.
A link for more details is provided: https://msme.gov.in/schemes/technology-upgradation-and-quality-certification.
The scheme is called National Awards (Individual MSEs).
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the scheme is Reward.
The sub-component of the scheme is Cash.
The applicants for this scheme are Micro and small enterprises.
The Quantum of Assistance for this scheme involves cash prizes to selected enterprises.
A link for more details is provided: http://www.dcmsme.gov.in/schemes/award_scheme.htm.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industries offers the Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme.
The Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme covers Technical Infrastructure, Physical Infrastructure, and Social Infrastructure.
State Implementation Agencies such as SIDCs can apply for funding under the Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme.
Applicants for the Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme should have sufficient past experience in executing projects of a similar nature.
Past experience of the SIA will be a major criterion for entrusting a project to the agency under the Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme.
The Government of India provides 50% support of the project cost (excluding land) for the Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme, subject to a ceiling of INR 50.00 Crore.

A link for details on the Modified Industrial Infrastructure Upgradation Scheme is available at https://dipp.gov.in/programmes-and-schemes/infrastructure/industrial-infrastructure-upgradation-scheme-iius.
SIDBI offers the Special Refinance scheme for MSME's.
The Special Refinance scheme for MSME's falls under the Credit component and Loan sub-component.
Micro and Small Enterprises as defined by the MSMED Act, 2006 are eligible applicants for the Special Refinance scheme for MSME's.
The Special Refinance scheme for MSME's provides financial assistance.
A link for details on the Special Refinance scheme for MSME's is available at https://sidbi.in/files/circulars/20200422161912.pdf.
The scheme is called 'Building Awareness on Intellectual Property Rights (IPR)'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the scheme is Technology.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance.
Registered MSME units, associations, consultancy firms, and expert agencies are eligible applicants.
The scheme provides assistance for conducting awareness/sensitization programs on IPR, with GoI assistance of Rs. 1 lakh per program.
The scheme provides assistance for conducting pilot studies for selected clusters/groups of industries, with GoI assistance of Rs. 2.5 lakh per pilot study.
The scheme provides funding support for conducting interactive seminars/workshops.
The scheme provides funding support for conducting specialized training on IPR.
The scheme provides funding support in the form of a grant on Patent/GI Registration.
The scheme provides funding support for setting up IP Facilitation.
The scheme is called 'Capital Goods Scheme'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises.
The component of the scheme is Grant.
The sub-component of the scheme is Finance.
MSMEs, local industries, industry associations, financial institutions, Central/State Government, R&D institutions, and Central/State PSUs are eligible applicants.
Central assistance will be provided as a one-time grant-in-aid, not exceeding 80% of the project cost.
The scheme is named 'Design Expertise to manufacturing sector'.
The Ministry/Department responsible for this scheme is the Ministry of MSME.
The component of the scheme is Grant.
The sub-component is Finance.
The applicant for this scheme is registered manufacturing MSMEs.
The quantum of assistance is a grant of Rs. 15 lakh to Rs. 40 lakh for design work.
