The Ministry of MSME, Government of India is co-sponsoring a World Bank supported scheme called Raising and Accelerating MSMEs Performance (RAMP).
The RAMP Programme aims to support the overall COVID Resilience and recovery Programme of the Ministry of MSME.
The RAMP Programme aims to improve market access, access to credit, strengthen institutions and governance at the Centre and State, address delayed payments, and promote the greening of MSMEs.
The Ministry of MSME, Government of India has issued RAMP Guidelines and Implementation Manual.
The Government of Andhra Pradesh (GoAP) has submitted a Letter of Understanding (LoU) to the Government of India expressing its willingness to participate in the RAMP Programme.
The Director of Industries, GoAP has been nominated as the Nodal Officer for the RAMP Programme in Andhra Pradesh.
The AP MSME Development Corporation, GoAP has been nominated as the State Nodal Agency for coordinating and implementing the RAMP Programme in Andhra Pradesh.

The Director of Industries and the AP MSME Development Corporation were requested to initiate the process for forming a State Programme Implementation Unit (SPIU) for preparing State Investment Plans (SIPs) under the RAMP Programme.
Participating states must submit a Strategic Investment Plan (SIP) to the Ministry of MSME with the approval of the State RAMP Programme Committee (SRPC).
The SRPC is headed by an officer not below the rank of Principal Secretary, Industries, and includes representation from other line departments like Infrastructure, Skills, and SLBC.
The Chief Executive Officer, AP MSME Development Corporation, requested the Government to constitute the State Raising and Accelerating MSMEs Performance (RAMP) Programme Committee (SRPC).
The Government of Andhra Pradesh has constituted the Andhra Pradesh State Raising and Accelerating MSMEs Performance (RAMP) Programme Committee (AP-SRPC).
The AP-SRPC is constituted as per the RAMP Programme Implementation Manual of the Ministry of MSME, Government of India.
The AP-SRPC will coordinate with the Ministry of MSME on RAMP Implementation.
The AP-SRPC will oversee the preparation process of the Strategic Investment Plan (SIP).
The AP-SRPC will approve the SIP to be submitted to the RAMP Programme Committee of the Ministry of MSME.
The AP-SRPC will conduct periodical reviews of RAMP Performance in the state to ensure inter-departmental/ministerial coordination for SIP preparation and implementation.
The AP-SRPC will monitor fund releases, utilization, and audits.
The AP-SRPC will oversee the functioning of State PIUs.
The AP-SRPC will approve the Work Plan, Budget, Annual Procurement Plans, and fund releases for SIP Implementation.
The Director of Industries and the CEO, AP MSME Development Corporation shall take further necessary action.
The Spl. Chief Secretary to Government, Industries & Commerce Department is the Chairperson of the AP-SRPC.
The Spl. Chief Secretary to Government, Finance Department is a Member of the AP-SRPC.
The Principal Secretary to Government, Skills Development & Training Department is a Member of the AP-SRPC.
The Director of Industries, Mangalagiri is a Member of the AP-SRPC.
The Convenor, State Level Bankers Committee is a Member of the AP-SRPC.
The Chief Executive Officer, AP MSME Development Corporation is the Member-Convener of the AP-SRPC.
The Government of Andhra Pradesh (GoAP) has issued the Andhra Pradesh Policy for establishment of Private Industrial Parks with 'Plug and Play' Industrial Infrastructure (4.0) 2024-29.
The policy aims to make Andhra Pradesh a progressive and highly industrialized state by promoting industrial growth, employment, and investment.
The policy aims to support and encourage the development of private Industrial Parks in the state by creating a framework to increase the participation of potential developers.
The policy aims to create a conducive environment for enterprises looking to diversify their manufacturing base and expand to new markets without compromising climate goals.
The policy aims to encourage enterprises looking to set up their base in India and consider Andhra Pradesh favorably as an investment destination.

The Finance Department has remarked that support for external infrastructure and capital support for CETPs, Desalination Plants, and Industrial Housing needs to be planned by the Department and APHIC.
The policy aims to establish parks with a mechanism to generate revenue to meet the cost of infrastructure development without creating additional financial liability to the government.
The Government has approved the Andhra Pradesh Policy for establishment of Private Industrial Parks with 'Plug and Play' Industrial Infrastructure (4.0) 2024-29.
Incentives mentioned in the policy will be extended to eligible industries as per operational guidelines to be notified separately.
The VC&MD, APIIC, the Director of Industries, Vijayawada, and the CEO, AP MSME Development Corporation, Vijayawada shall take necessary action for implementing operating guidelines for this Policy.
The policy objectives include promoting and enabling the development of world-class Industrial Parks by private sector agencies in Andhra Pradesh.
The policy objectives include enabling the provision of world-class Operation & Maintenance in the Industrial Parks.
The policy objectives include generating employment and attracting investment by creating a conducive environment for investments in the state.
The policy objectives include creating an enabling framework for pooling land from farmers for the creation of Industrial Parks.
The policy objectives include promoting the establishment of sector-specific industrial parks.
The Department of Industries & Commerce, Government of Andhra Pradesh, or any other authorized agency, shall be the executing agency for the Andhra Pradesh Private Industrial Parks Policy, 2024.
The policy shall be known as the Andhra Pradesh Policy for establishment of Private Industrial Parks with 'Plug and Play' Industrial Infrastructure (4.0) 2024-29.
The policy will come into force from the date of issuance of the Government Order (G.O.) and shall remain in force for a period of five years.
'APICDA' refers to Andhra Pradesh Industrial Corridor Development Authority.
'APIC' refers to Andhra Pradesh Industrial Infrastructure Corporation Limited.
'APMSMEDC' refers to Andhra Pradesh Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises Development Corporation Limited.
'Commencement of Operations' refers to the commencement of commercial production/service of the unit.

'Common Internal Infrastructure' includes facilities like internal roads, drainage, streetlights, water distribution, electricity/energy/gas distribution, communication network, effluent treatment plant, and common facilities centers within the Industrial Park.

'Completion of Industrial Park' means at least 50% of the land for industrial activity has been sold/leased, industrial units occupying at least 50% of that area have commenced operations, and at least 50% of the planned fixed capital investment (excluding land) has been incurred.
'Developer' refers to any individual, company, firm, society, trust, public sector undertaking, or other entity that proposes to develop or develop and operate Industrial Parks.
'DPR' means a detailed project report.
'Estimated Project Cost' includes fixed capital investment in building and infrastructure, cost of land, and cost of providing all external infrastructure.
'Flatted Factory Complex (FFC)' is a multi-story industrial building divided into smaller units for separate use by various businesses.
'Financial Year' refers to a year beginning on April 1 and ending on March 31 of the succeeding year.
'GoAP' refers to the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
'IALA' refers to the Industrial Area Local Authority.
'Industrial Activity' includes manufacturing, development of computer software and IT-enabled products/services, and other services.

'Industrial Park' means an industrial area or estate developed primarily for the establishment of manufacturing/service units, including developed plots, residential/commercial establishments, warehousing units, and common internal infrastructure.
'Facilities of the Industrial Parks under the Policy' are the facilities that should be present within the industrial parks to be eligible for policy benefits.
'Industrial Unit' refers to a unit located in the Industrial Park, which is a separate entity assessable to tax and carrying out Industrial Activity.
'Large Parks' refer to industrial parks covering a minimum area of more than 100 Acres and up to 1,000 Acres.
'Mega Parks' refer to industrial parks covering a minimum area of more than 1,000 Acres of contiguous land.
'Legal Status' refers to the legal entity of the Developer at the time of DPR submission.
'MSME' refers to industrial units/enterprises classified by the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises of the Govt. of India.
'MSME Parks' refer to Industrial Parks spread over 10 to 100 Acres of contiguous land, with most allotments made to MSME Industrial Units.
'Single Desk Portal' refers to the portal set up under the Andhra Pradesh Single Desk Policy 2015.
'Nano or Tiny Parks' refer to industrial parks spread over an extent lesser than 10 Acres of contiguous land.
The Policy will ordinarily cover locations that can be developed into Industrial Parks.
The Policy targets industrial clusters/locations with high growth potential requiring strategic interventions through world-class infrastructure support.
The Industrial Park proposed under this policy will have components including Land, Processing Area, and Non-processing purposes (for Large and Mega Parks).
The Processing Area includes Common Infrastructure, Industrial plots and Factory buildings, Buildings for common facilities, and Open spaces/roads/pathways.

Non-processing purposes can include Business related offices, Convention centres, Business centres, Education and Skill training centres, Hotels, Service apartments, Housing, Schools, Hospitals, Entertainment centres, shopping malls, and Open spaces/roads/pathways.
The Project Cost for the purpose of this Policy includes the cost of components listed under Group B (Processing Area).
Parks with Processing Units in sectors like Textile, Leather, or other Red Category Line of Activity based industries should strive to have a Zero Liquid Discharge CETP or a proper marine outfall.
The Policy intends to promote the establishment of Plug n Play Industrial Parks and Flatted Factory Sheds, especially in Nano and MSME Parks.

Essential components of Industrial Parks with Plug n Play facilities include readily available roads, ready-built sewerage connection, electrical lines, water connection facilities, natural gas pipeline (wherever applicable), ready-built utility service-fire hydrants line, ready-built commercial centre, ready-built skill development centre, and ready-built bank and ATM facility.

The Policy shall also be applicable to Specific Industrial Parks such as Biotechnology Park, Pharmaceutical Park, Toy Park, Electric Vehicles Park, Semiconductor Park, Defence and Aerospace Park, Food Processing Parks, Leather Parks, Textiles Parks, etc.

Government will take necessary action to notify under Section-3 of the AP Industrial Corridor Development Act, 2017, to integrate these Private Parks along the three Industrial Corridors across the State.

Desirable Facilities within the Industrial Park include testing labs, training centers, trade centers, warehousing facilities, packaging units, creche, canteen, workers' hostels, offices of service providers, labor rest and recreation facilities, and marketing support systems.

Other 'Good to Have' Facilities include convention centers, business and trade related office spaces, worker's education and skill training centers, hotels, service apartments, housing, schools, hospitals, and entertainment centers and shopping malls.
All Private Mega Industrial Parks and select Private Large Industrial Parks shall be eligible for IALA status.
Layouts of Industrial Parks approved under the Policy will be approved expeditiously by the APICDA or concerned UDA without any fees.
Building Plan approvals will be sanctioned by IALA or concerned Local Bodies through Single Desk Portal 2.0.
The Executing Agency and the Evaluation Committee shall handhold the Private Developer for obtaining required Environment Clearance.
The Policy is flexible to accommodate all possible models of Park Development and Maintenance and Provision of Services.
Private Developers may own the majority of lands or pool lands from farmers.
Model - I: Industrial Park Development with complete private land.
Model - II: Industrial Park Development with Partial Government / APIC Land.
Model - III: Industrial Park Development with Complete Government/APIIC Land.
In Model - III, the Executive Agency will select Private Developers through a transparent and competitive bidding process.
The selected Private Developer shall enter into an Agreement for undertaking project development activities.
The policy intends to provide flexibility to accommodate existing or innovatively conceptualized Industrial Park development models.

Incentives for Private Nano or Tiny and MSME Parks include up to 100% exemption of Conversion Charges, charges for Change of Land Use, Layout Approval, and Stamp Duty and Registration Charges for pooling lands.
Developers of MSME Parks are eligible for a Capital Subsidy of up to Rs. 5 lakhs per acre.
Incentives and subsidies for MSME Parks are eligible after the lands have been registered in the name of the Private Developer.

Incentives for Private Large Industrial Parks and Mega Industrial Parks include up to 100% exemption of Conversion Charges, charges for Change of Land Use, Layout Approval, and Stamp Duty and Registration Charges for pooling lands.
Developers of Large and Mega Parks are eligible for a Capital Subsidy of up to Rs. 3 lakhs per acre.
Developers are eligible for separate capital support for CETPs and Desalination Plants.
The policy encourages industrial projects to build housing and hostels for employees within 5 km of these Industrial parks.
The government will facilitate the development of Industrial housing facilities / Industrial Hostels in all Mega Parks and select Large Parks.
Incentives and subsidies for Large and Mega Parks are eligible after the lands have been registered in the name of the Private Developer.
The select proposals shortlisted by the Evaluation Committee will be shared with Stakeholder Departments for necessary approvals and clearances.

Stakeholder Departments include Municipal Administration & Urban Development, Roads & Buildings, Water Resources, DISCOMS, Panchayati Raj & Rural Development, and Andhra Pradesh Pollution Control Board (APPCB).

APIC / APMSMEDC or any other agency notified by GoAP shall be the nodal agency to issue Expression of Interest (EoI) / Request for Proposal (RFP) documents and evaluate proposals for screening purposes.
APIC, APMSMEDC or any other agency notified by GoAP will formulate the External Infra Support Plan.
A Private Industrial Parks Evaluation Committee will be constituted to finalize the External Infra Support Plan and recommend proposals for approval.
The Finance Department will be part of the Evaluation Committee.
Proposals recommended by the Committee will be brought for approval of the Cabinet.
Approved Parks will be notified under Andhra Pradesh Industrial Corridor Development Act, 2017.
Govt. of AP will facilitate dovetailing of relevant Gol schemes for the support of select Private Industrial Parks.
The operating guidelines for this policy will be issued separately.
The Government of Andhra Pradesh is issuing tender documents for the supply, installation, testing, commissioning, and trial run of machinery and equipment on a turnkey basis.
The tender is for establishing a Common Facility Centre (CFC) for the food processing cluster at Santhavuriti village, G Sigadam Mandal, Srikakulam District, Andhra Pradesh.
The Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) for this project is Sunrise Nature Foods Foundation.
The Tender Notice Number is APMSMEDC/INC64/52/2024, dated 19.08.2025.
The Tender Inviting Authority is the ANDHRA PRADESH MSME DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION.

The tender documents include sections on Introduction, Instruction to Bidders, Conditions of Contract, Schedule of Requirements, Specifications, Price Schedule, Contract Form, and Other Standard Forms.
The Bid Calling Date is 19.08.2025.
The Pre-bid meeting date and time is 25.08.2025 at 12:30 PM (Hybrid).
The Pre-bid clarifications issue date is 29.08.2025 at 5:30 PM.
The Bid closing date and time is 10.09.2025 at 5:30 PM.
The Technical Bid Opening Date and time is 12.09.2025 at 3:00 PM.
The Financial Bid Opening Date and Time will be intimated later.
The Andhra Pradesh MSME Development Corporation (APMSMEDC) is a fully owned Government of Andhra Pradesh entity.
APMSMEDC is the Implementing Agency for existing and new CFCs in Andhra Pradesh.
In this tender, the lowest price is the sole criterion for selecting the item/supplier.
A two-bid system is followed to eliminate technically unsuitable items and financially/technically incapable firms.
Procurement will be subject to Public Procurement (Preference to Make in India) Order 2017, revised on 16-09-2020.
After-sales service and up-time guarantee are of paramount importance.
All decisions will be published on the e-procurement website: https://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app.
The purpose of the bid is to establish a Common Facility Centre (CFC) in the food processing sector under the MSE-CDP guidelines.
Sunrise Nature Foods Foundation (SPV) has been constituted for this purpose.
Funds for this procurement are made available by the Central Government, State Government of Andhra Pradesh, and SPV to the CEO, APMSMEDC under the MSE-CDP Scheme.
APMSMEDC can modify or extend the bidding documents by amendment.
APMSMEDC may extend the deadline for bid submission at its discretion.
The CEO APMSMEDC has the right to cancel the tender at any time in the interest of public money.
Disputes will be subject to the jurisdiction of the local court in Vijayawada.
Abbreviations used include APMSMEDC, BG, CEO, CFC, CPPP, EMD, GFR, LD, MAF, MSE-CDP, MSME, PS/SD, SPV, TIA, and Technical Specifications.
Bidders shall not approach APMSMEDC officers beyond office hours or outside office premises.
Any effort by a bidder to influence APMSMEDC officers may result in rejection of the offer and ineligibility for future bids.
APMSMEDC reserves the right to increase or decrease the quantity at the time of award.
APMSMEDC reserves the right to modify/extend/cancel the tender at any point of time without prior notice or reasoning.
Successful bidders will be intimated in writing and the contract form will be signed upon submission of Performance Bank Guarantee.
APMSMEDC reserves the right to alter, add, or delete contract conditions in the interest of public money.
APMSMEDC reserves the right to negotiate with the bidder with the lowest quote, including technical specifications.
Bidders must upload OEM standard brochures with technical specifications for machinery.
Successful bidders must supply operation and maintenance manuals in English or Telugu, along with drawings.
The successful bidder shall provide licenses for all software products.
The bidder shall indemnify the purchaser against all third-party claims of infringement of patent, trademarks, or industrial design rights.
Sub-contracting is not allowed in this Works contract.
The bid process involves e-procurement through the Government of India's platform.
Bidders must register on the e-procurement platform and submit bids online.
Technical bids and financial bids are submitted simultaneously through the online portal.
Bidders must download contract documents and any corrigenda, read and understand them, and seek clarifications in writing before the pre-bid meeting.
Bidders must submit a technical compliance statement as per Form T-1.
Non-submission of Form T-1 implies agreement to the specifications mentioned in the contract form.
Contract documents must be signed in ink by the authorized signatory on each page and stamped.
Scanned copies of contract documents are to be uploaded; physical documents are not encouraged.
The authorized signatory's authority must be uploaded.
Shortage of documents leads to rejection in Technical Evaluation.
Qualified bidders will be notified automatically, and the financial bid opening date will be communicated via email.
Financial bids must be submitted along with the technical bid in the e-portal.
Bidders must upload the cost sheet breakup with the financial bid, indicating total values including all costs, services, warranty, AMC, taxes, etc.
If the price bid/cost sheet is attached with technical bid documents, the bid will be disqualified.
The financial bid of technically qualified bidders will be opened.
The Tender Inviting Authority is The CEO, Andhra Pradesh MSME Development Corporation.
The End User is The Director, Sunrise Nature Food Foundation (SPV).
E Procurement Help Desk numbers are provided for technical queries.
Bid currency is Indian Rupee (INR) only.
The Cost of Tender Form is Rs. 5,000/- (Non-Refundable).
Payment for the tender form is to be made through NEFT to APMSMEDC A/c No 39677901097.
Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) are exempted from Tender form/Bid Security/EMD deposits upon submission of relevant documents.
Bid Security/EMD for this turnkey project is Rs. 50 Lakh.
Bid Security/EMD must be submitted in the form of Bank Guarantee/DD favoring The CEO, APMSMEDC, Vijayawada.
Soft copy of the Bank Guarantee/DD must be uploaded, and the original must be submitted by hand or post within 48 hours of the Bid closing date.
Non-receipt of original Bid Security/EMD leads to tender disqualification.
Bid Security/EMD of unsuccessful bidders will be released within 30 days of the Award of Contract.
The Successful Bidder/Bidders must submit Performance Security/Security deposit at 5% of the contract awarded value.
Performance Security must remain valid for sixty days beyond the completion of all contractual obligations, including warranty.
Bank Guarantee for Performance Security is to be submitted within 15 days of award of contract, favoring Sunrise Nature Foods Foundation, Srikakulam.
Performance Security can be submitted in multiple parts: for machinery supply and for warranty/AMC.
Non-receipt of Performance security in the stipulated period leads to forfeiture of Bid Security/EMD and other statutory actions.

The financial bid is inclusive of Supply, Delivery, Installation, Trial Run, Commissioning, Training of staff, Warranty Period (one year or manufacturer's specifications, whichever is higher), and additional Annual Maintenance Contract for two years.
The value is all-inclusive of machinery cost, services, taxes, transportation, etc.
The successful contractor will be paid depending on fund availability from the Government of India.
The successful contractor must submit a detailed project execution plan with timelines for approval by the SPV management.
Bid Validity Period is 180 days from the date of opening of bids.
The decision of the CEO, APMSMEDC is final on quantity variations.
Contract Signing must be within 15 days from the Award of contract upon submission of PBG.
Contract Execution Period: Successful bidders must complete machine installation and other contractual obligations within 60 days from the contract agreement date.
Liquidated Damages (LD) for late deliveries/installations are 1% of the late delivered goods for one week or part thereof, up to a maximum penalty of 5%.
Late deliveries/installations beyond the permissible period attract LD recoveries, encashment of PBG, and other statutory actions.
Delay from SPV side in handing over the shed for installation will not be attributable to the bidder.
Payment Terms are structured in four installments: 30% on signing of Contract, 30% on intimation of Machine readiness, 30% on Installation of Machinery, and 10% on completion of contract.
Bidders must be manufacturers/authorized representatives/whole sale dealers/Distributors in business for at least three years.
Preference may be given to bidders registered in India, especially in Andhra Pradesh.
Bidders must submit a certificate confirming they have read and understood the tender documents.
Bidders must submit a Manufacturer's Authorization Form (MAF) for all offered products.
The bidder/OEM may have a Registered Service Centre/Franchise Service Centre in Andhra Pradesh.
Bidders must have positive net worth and disclose annual turnover for the last three financial years (2022-23, 2023-24, 2024-25).
The minimum eligibility turnover for a Manufacturer is Rs. 40.00 Crores in any one FY.
The minimum eligibility turnover for a Dealer/Distributor/Authd. Sales & Service is Rs. 20.00 Crores in any one FY.
The Bidder/OEM should have cumulative sales of related machinery of at least 5 Nos. in the last three financial years.
Bidders must furnish information on major past supplies.
Bidders must submit a declaration stating they are not debarred/blacklisted by any government or quasi-government body.
Bidder from a country sharing a land border with India is eligible only if registered with the Competent Authority as per G.O. Ms. No. 9, Dt. 25-02-2021.
Bidders must submit an undertaking as per Form-P8.
Bidders must submit a declaration regarding technical specifications compliance (Higher, Complied, or Lower) in Form T1.
Bids shall be submitted online on https://eprocure.gov.in.
Bidders must scan and upload documents in Pre-Qualification and Technical bid documentation.
Rates should be quoted in INR and online only.
After uploading documents, Bid Security (EMD) must be submitted to the CEO, APMSMEDC, Mangalagiri.
False/fabricated/bogus documents will lead to disqualification and blacklisting.
APMSMEDC is not responsible for non-visibility of scanned and uploaded documents.
Documents uploaded online and clarifications taken by APMSMEDC will be considered for Bid Evaluation.
The Bidder is wholly responsible for supply, installation, and other services as per the contractual agreement.
The successful bidder must deliver a fully functional, tested, and commissioned facility.
Bidders are advised to visit the site and calculate actual requirements.
The successful bidder must submit an execution plan for product-wise completion.
The successful bidder is responsible for machinery installation as per OEM guidelines.
The bidder must provide machinery drawings, flow charts, user manuals, periodic maintenance schedules, and spare parts lists in English.
The bidder must quote for the latest machinery or machinery with suitable life, not obsolete machinery.
The bidder is obligated to upgrade technological developments during the Warranty & AMC Period.
In case of unforeseen circumstances preventing fulfillment of the contract, the bidder must communicate immediately.
Liquidated Damages (LD) will be imposed at 1% per week, up to a maximum of 5% of the total contract value, for failure to fulfill contractual obligations.
The supplier may be blacklisted as per existing rules and regulations.
If the bidder becomes bankrupt or insolvent, the CEO APMSMEDC may terminate the contract.
Disputes will be resolved amicably through negotiations; if not resolved in a month, either party may seek remedy under the Arbitration & Reconciliation Act.
The successful bidders must supply machinery on a turnkey basis to M/S Sunrise Nature Foods Foundation (SPV) at specified Sy. No.s.
The successful bidders must establish a food processing industry on a turnkey basis, including supply, installation, testing, commissioning, trial run, and training.

The schedule of requirements includes Racking System- Cold Storage, Plastic Roto Pallets, Plate type Evaporate Condenser, Falling Film Chiller, Insulated Water Base Tank, Recirculation Water Pump, Ripening Equipment, Automatic Gas Dosing with Piping & Electric cables, Refrigeration System for IQF & 2 Blast Freezers, Refrigeration system for Cold Rooms & Anti Rooms, IQF line, PUF Wall, Ceiling & Partition Panels, Floor Insulation, Insulated Doors, Flashings & Accessories, Corn-Pre Processing Line, Mango Pre-Processing Line, Retort, Canning, Pulping Line, Electrical Lines & Systems, Boiler, Water Treatment Plant, Effluent Treatment Plant, Pallets & Crates, Dicer, Compressors, and Ammonia Pumps.

The CFC will provide facilities for Sweet Corn Retort, Frozen Sweet Corn Kernels Manufacturing, Frozen Mango Dices Manufacture, Pineapple Canning Process, Frozen Jack Fruit product Manufacture, Custard Apple Pulp Manufacturing Process, and Cold Storage Facility.

The proposed capacities at the CFC include IQF (9600 MT/pa), Blast Freezing (1440 MT/pa), Retort (4800 MT/pa), Pulping (1440 MT/pa), Canning (480 kg/pa), Ripening (40 MT/pa), and Cold Storage (1782 Pallets).
The successful contractor must inspect the site, prepare the process flow diagram, and initiate supply, erection, and commissioning upon approval.

Specifications for Racking System - Cold Storage include a capacity for 1782 Pallets each @ 1 MT Capacity, designed for temperatures ranging from -25Â°C up to +5Â°C, with a nominal payload of 1 MT per pallet location and a safety factor.
Specifications for Plastic Roto Pallets include a Static Load Capacity of 4 MT, Dynamic Load Capacity of 1 MT, and Racking Load Capacity of 1 MT.

Specifications for Plate Type Evaporative Condenser include a Heat Rejection Capacity of 1000 kW, designed for ammonia refrigeration applications, with SS 304 construction for plates, basin, and casing.
Specifications for Falling Film Chiller include a cooling capacity of 110 KW System and compatibility with refrigerants like R717 (Ammonia).
Specifications for Insulated Water Base Tank include SS 304 interior and exterior, with polyurethane foam (PUF) insulation of at least 2 inches thickness.
Specifications for Recirculation Water Pump include compliance with IS 5659:1970 and IS 5120:1977, with SS 304 or SS 316 preferred for water contact parts.

Specifications for Ripening Equipment include chambers with a capacity of 40 MT, requiring approximately 11 cubic meters per metric ton of fruit, with PUF insulation panels and a temperature range of 15Â°C to 18Â°C and humidity of 85% to 95%.
Specifications for Automatic Gas Dosing with Piping & Electric cables include maintaining ethylene concentrations between 10 to 200 ppm.
Specifications for Refrigeration System for IQF & 2 Blast Freezers include maintaining temperatures at or below -18Â°C for IQF and -35Â°C to -40Â°C for Blast Freezers.
Specifications for Refrigeration system for Cold Rooms & Anti Rooms include temperature ranges of -18Â°C to -25Â°C for Cold Rooms and +2Â°C to +10Â°C for Ante Rooms, with PUF insulated panels.
Specifications for IQF line include a capacity of 2 Ton per hour.

Specifications for PUF Wall, Ceiling & Partition Panels, Floor Insulation, Insulated Doors, Flashings & Accessories include Polyurethane Foam (PUF) panels with specific densities and thicknesses, and compliance with IS 12436.
Specifications for Corn-Pre Processing Line include a capacity of 2000 Kg/Hour, with contact parts made of SS 304.

Specifications for Mango Pre-Processing Line include components like Feed Conveyor, Washing Unit, Inspection Conveyor, Destoner/Peeler, Slicer/Dicer, Blancher, Cooling Section, and Dewatering Conveyor, with MOC of SS 304 for contact areas.
Specifications for Retort include a type selected based on product, with a chamber size, design pressure up to 2.5 bar, design temperature up to 135Â°C, and SS 304 construction.
Specifications for Canning include equipment like Can Rinsing Station, Filling Machine, Seamer Machine, Exhaust Box, Cooling Tunnel, and Labeling & Coding, with speeds of 10-60 cans/min.
Specifications for Pulping Line include components like Fruit Elevator, Washer/Sorter, Fruit Crusher/De-stoner, Pulper/Finisher, Screw Pump, and Storage Tank, with a capacity of 0.5-2 TPH.
Specifications for Electrical Lines & Systems include a Main LT Panel, Sub Distribution Boards (DBs), cabling as per IS 7098, and LED IP65-rated lighting.
Specifications for Boiler include IBR Steam Boiler type, with a capacity of 300 - 1000 kg/hr and working pressure of 7-10.5 kg/cm.
Specifications for Water Treatment Plant and Effluent Treatment Plant are listed as SI. No. 20 and 21 respectively, with Qty 01.

Specifications for Pallets & Crates include Plastic Pallets (1200 mm x 1000 mm or 1200 mm x 800 mm) with Static Load: 3000-5000 kg, and Plastic Crates (e.g., 600x400x250 mm) with Load Capacity: 20-30 kg.
Specifications for Dicer include dice size range from ~3 mm to 25 mm, capacity of ~1 to 5 tons/hr, and MOC of Stainless Steel 304.
Specifications for Compressors include types like Semi-Hermetic Reciprocating, Screw, and Scroll, with refrigeration capacity ~25-150 TR.
Specifications for Ammonia Pumps include Centrifugal Pump type, flow rate 10 to 60 m/hr, head 15-30 meters TDH, and working pressure 16-25 bar.

The Government of Andhra Pradesh is participating in the Central Sector Scheme 'Raising and Accelerating MSME Performance (RAMP)' supported by the World Bank.
The Director of Industries, GoAP, is nominated as the Nodal Officer for the RAMP programme.
AP MSME Development Corporation, GoAP, is nominated as the State Nodal Agency for the RAMP Programme.
States/UTs are requested to sign a Letter of Undertaking (LoU) to participate in the RAMP programme.
The RAMP programme aims to improve MSMEs' access to market and credit, strengthen institutions, and address delayed payments and greening of MSMEs.
The RAMP programme seeks to address generic and COVID-related challenges in the MSME sector.
States are required to prepare a Strategic Investment Plan (SIP) for the RAMP programme.
MoMSME will provide grant funding for SIP activities.
The State/UT shall set up and maintain a State/UT Programme Implementation Unit (SPIU).
The State/UT agrees to ensure convergence of investments from ongoing/new schemes.
Disbursement Linked Indicators (DLIs) are a key part of the RAMP programme design.
The State/UT shall maintain a financial management system and prepare financial statements.
Interventions under the RAMP programme will not finance infrastructure or high-value contracts above certain thresholds.
Procurement under the RAMP programme must be guided by the General Financial Rules (GFRs)-2017 and the Indian Contract Act.
Contracts shall not be awarded to any World Bank debarred firm.
The State/UT shall prepare a procurement plan and award contracts as per the approved SIP.
The State/UT shall establish and/or maintain policies and procedures for MoMSME supervision and monitoring.
The State/UT shall prepare and furnish information and progress reports to MoMSME.
The State/UT shall accept inspections by MoMSME, the World Bank, and the Independent Verification Agency (IVA).
The State/UT shall maintain records and accounts and have them audited.
The State/UT shall ensure activities are implemented in accordance with CVC Guidelines and World Bank's Anti-Corruption Guidelines.
The State/UT shall carry out programme activities in accordance with the 'Strategy to Strengthen Environment and Social Management'.
No activities under the RAMP programme shall resort to land acquisition.
MoMSME will make available grant funding for SIP part-financing upon request and subject to approved allocation.
Annual financial releases will be based on SIP approval, implementation, expenditures, and achievement of milestones.
If the State/UT fails to meet conditions or obligations, it shall be liable to refund grant support.
MoMSME has the right to suspend or terminate the State/UT's right to use programme funds.
The Letter of Undertaking (LoU) for the RAMP Programme was signed on 15th September 2022 at Amaravati, Andhra Pradesh.
The LoU is between the State of Andhra Pradesh and the Government of India, represented by MoMSME.
The RAMP programme aims to increase the competitiveness of the MSME sector.
MoMSME will provide grant funding for part financing of SIP activities.
The State/UT shall conduct a diagnostic exercise and prepare a Strategic Investment Plan (SIP).
The SPIU shall be staffed with competent, experienced, and qualified staff and/or consultants.
The RAMP Programme will support the costs of the diagnostic exercise and SIP preparation.
Participation in the RAMP Programme will be confirmed by MoMSME based on the quality of the SIP.
The LoU specifies the main responsibilities and implementation arrangements of MoMSME and the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
The LoU remains in effect until the closure of the RAMP Programme.
The State/UT shall ensure convergence of investments.
The State/UT acknowledges that the Programme is designed around Disbursement Linked Indicators (DLIs).
The State/UT shall ensure utilization of all funds exclusively towards financing activities as per the approved SIP.
The State/UT shall ensure all procurements and expenditures are guided by GFRs, Delegation of Financial Powers and Rules, Government Orders, and the Indian Contract Act.
The State/UT shall prepare a procurement plan and award contracts as per the approved SIP.
The State/UT shall provide required information and progress reports to MoMSME.
The State/UT shall accept inspections by MoMSME, the World Bank, and the IVA.
The State/UT shall prepare progress reports based on standard reporting templates.
The State/UT shall maintain records and accounts and have them audited.
The State/UT shall ensure activities are implemented in accordance with anti-corruption guidelines.
The State/UT shall carry out programme activities in accordance with environmental and social management strategies.
MoMSME undertakes to make available grant funding for SIP part-financing.
Annual financial releases will be based on SIP approval, implementation, expenditures, and achievement of milestones.
If the State/UT fails to meet conditions, it shall be liable to refund grant support.
MoMSME has the right to suspend or terminate the State/UT's right to use programme funds.
The Government of Andhra Pradesh has issued G.O.Ms. No. 75 on 19.11.2024.
This G.O. pertains to the formalization of MSMEs under the Raising and Accelerating MSME Performance (RAMP) program.
It announces the resumption of the survey of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in the State effective from 4.11.2024.
The survey aims to facilitate the registration of MSMEs on the Udyam Portal or Udyam Assist Platform.
Previous guidelines for identifying and formalizing MSMEs through a survey were issued in G.O.Ms.No. 24, Ind. & Com. (Prog-I) Dept., Dated 23-02-2024 (5th read above).
A mobile app-based MSME Survey was previously conducted, covering details of 1.32 Lakh MSMEs from the State.
This earlier survey utilized the services of Engineering Assistants (EAs) at the village secretariat.
The survey was temporarily halted until the end of the elections, as per Govt. Memo. No.2355417/Prog-I/A2/2024, Dt:26/03/2024 (6th read above).
As of 21st October 2024, only about 10.12 lakh MSMEs in the State have obtained Udyam registrations.
The estimated number of MSMEs in the State is 33.78 lakh, based on the 73rd round of the National Sample Survey in 2015-16.
This indicates a significant gap of over 23.66 lakh unregistered MSMEs in Andhra Pradesh.
The Government aims to resume the MSME Survey comprehensively to understand industry requirements and identify gaps in technological, production, and managerial skills.
The goal is to foster a more competitive industrial ecosystem and boost MSME productivity and innovation.
The survey will map MSME requirements for certifications like ZED and LEAN to improve quality and marketing capabilities.
Skilling and re-skilling initiatives will be designed based on the survey's findings to address industry needs.
The collected data will guide the development of sector-specific infrastructure, such as common facility centers.
This initiative will support long-term policy formulation to foster a business-friendly environment and improve the speed of doing business.
The MSME Formalization Survey will be conducted under the supervision of District Collectors.
General Managers of District Industries Centres (DICs) will serve as district nodal officers.
District nodal officers will ensure smooth communication and data flow.
Sachivalayam staff, under the leadership of District Collectors, will conduct the survey using a Mobile Survey App.
Mandal or Corporation Level Special Officers will oversee survey activities and coordinate with field surveyors.
Additional personnel may be nominated by District Collectors to assist in the survey.
The revamped MSME Survey will re-approach the 1.32 Lakh MSMEs covered earlier to collect additional information for Udyam registration and planning interventions.
The AP MSME One Portal will be integrated with the Udyam Portal for effective formalization.
An online dashboard will be developed by AP MSME DC to monitor survey progress at district, mandal, and village levels.
District Collectors will have access to their own dashboards, while the Commissioner of Industries and AP MSME DC will track state and district-level performance.
The survey is expected to be completed by 1st February 2025.
The Government has accorded permission to conduct the revamped MSME survey for MSME formalization under RAMP.
The timeline for completing various tasks under the MSME formalization initiative is provided.
Finalization of MSME Survey App is due by 15.11.2024.
Training of GM-DICS and ZM-APIIC is due by 25.11.2024.
Training of Mandal level Special Officers, Municipal Commissioners, ADCS and Special Officers is due by 27.11.2024.
Training of Village/Ward Secretariat Functionaries is due by 28.11.2024.
Mapping of Village/Ward Secretariat Functionaries and finalizing survey areas is due by 29.11.2024.
Commencement of Survey is from 29.11.2024 onwards.
Random checks by supervisory officers and final survey to cover missing MSMEs is due by 17.01.2025.
Completion of Survey is due by 01.02.2025.
Coordination between departments and stakeholders is essential for survey execution.
Necessary training on the Mobile Survey App will be provided.
A dedicated technical support team will be available.
The coverage and responsibilities of various stakeholder departments/agencies are detailed in Annexure-1.
The CEO, AP MSME Development Corporation, and the Director of Industries, along with line departments and agencies, shall take necessary action.
The Secretary of Industries shall conduct periodic reviews of district-wise progress.
District Collectors are instructed to take necessary action to conduct and facilitate the survey.
District Collectors shall appoint Mandal and Corporation Level Special Officers to monitor the survey.
District Collectors shall conduct meetings with MSME associations, Chambers of Commerce, and trade associations to explain the survey's objectivity and methodology.
District Collectors shall actively engage with MSMEs through press meets and stakeholder meetings.
Pre-survey visits to MSMEs will be conducted to sensitize them and fix survey dates.
Village/Ward Secretariat Functionaries are responsible for implementing the survey at the ground level.
They will identify MSMEs in their jurisdiction using available data sources.
They will conduct pre-survey visits to sensitize MSMEs and take appointments.
They will reach out to MPDOs or Municipal Commissioners for query resolution.
They will provide an undertaking confirming all businesses in their purview have been surveyed.
MPDOs/Special Officers will work with GM-DIC to understand survey objectives and processes.
They will plan and execute data collection with Ward/Village Secretariat Staff.
They will cross-verify at least 5% of the collected data randomly.
Municipal Commissioners/Special Officers will coordinate with ADCs and Commissionerate staff for municipal corporations.
For municipalities and Nagar Panchayats, they will work with GM-DIC to understand survey processes.
They will plan and execute data collection with Ward Secretariat Staff.
They will cross-verify at least 5% of the collected data randomly.
GM - District Industries Center (DIC)/ Zonal Managers - APIIC will provide district-level support.
They will submit daily and weekly reports to District Collectors.
They will validate and cross-verify at least 1% of the data randomly at the district level.
They will provide a help desk at the DIC office.
They will attend review meetings by the CEO, AP MSME DC.
They will provide a closure report at the end of the survey.
The survey will cover all immovable businesses in the manufacturing, services, trade, and retail sectors.
The survey will be facilitated by the Village/Ward Secretariat (GV/WV & VS/WS) Department in collaboration with APIC, Directorate of Industries, DICs, MPDOs, and District Collectors.
Andhra Pradesh MSME Development Corporation (AP MSME DC) is the state nodal agency.
The survey will be conducted using mobile phones provided by the Department of GV/WV & VS/WS.
The mobile app can be downloaded from the Google Play Store.
The survey will span over 3 months, covering more than 24 lakh MSMEs.

The MSME Survey and Support Questionnaire has 5 sections: Udyam Registration details, additional MSME formalization details, sector-specific questionnaire, credit assistance details, employment and HR details, and marketing details.
The reports generated will be verified for accuracy.
Survey progress will be visible online at https://APMSMEONE.ap.gov.in.
The detailed survey data will be owned by the Department of Industries and Commerce.
The technical partner of AP MSME DC will follow applicable standards for the mobile app and data processing.
District Collectors, Municipal Commissioners, MPDOs, GM-DICS, and ZMs APIIC will receive orientation/training.
GM-DICs and ZM-APIIC will train MPDOs, Municipal Commissioners, and ADCs.
MPDOs and Municipal Commissioners will conduct training for Village/Ward Secretariat Staff.
A training video will be made available by AP MSME DC.
The GV/WV & VS/WS Department should provide administrative oversight for the Village/Ward Secretariats involved in the survey.
The MA&UD Department will instruct Urban Local Bodies to provide support and trade license data.
The Panchayat Raj and Rural Development Department will instruct Gram Panchayats to provide support and trade license data.
The Energy Department will provide data on industry and commercial electricity connections.
The Labour and Employment Department will provide supportive data and ensure district officials' participation.
The Factories Department will ensure district officials' participation and share available databases.
The Directorate of Industries will collaborate with AP MSME DC to align survey outcomes with industrial policies.
Joint Directors will oversee the execution of the formalization initiative.
The Commissioner of Industries will conduct weekly reviews.

The Government of Andhra Pradesh (GoAP) aims to make Andhra Pradesh a progressive and highly industrialized state.
GoAP prioritizes industrial growth to promote employment and attract investments.
Global manufacturers are seeking new production bases to diversify operations due to the evolving geopolitical landscape.
India is a preferred destination for major multinationals due to its large consumer market.
The VC&MD of APIIC Ltd. submitted a proposal for the Andhra Pradesh Policy for establishment of Private Industrial Parks with 'Plug and Play' Industrial Infrastructure (4.0) 2024-29.
This policy aims to create a conducive environment for enterprises looking to diversify their manufacturing base and expand to new markets without compromising climate goals.
The policy encourages enterprises to set up their base in India and consider Andhra Pradesh as an investment destination.

The Finance Department noted that support for external infrastructure (road, water) and capital support for CETPs, Desalination Plants, and Industrial Housing needs to be planned by the Department and APHIC.
The plan should include a mechanism to generate revenue to cover infrastructure development costs without creating additional financial liability for the government.
The Government of Andhra Pradesh has approved the Andhra Pradesh Policy for establishment of Private Industrial Parks with 'Plug and Play' Industrial Infrastructure (4.0) 2024-29.
Incentives mentioned in the policy will be extended to eligible industries as per operational guidelines to be notified separately.
The VC&MD of APIIC, the Director of Industries, Vijayawada, and the CEO of AP MSME Development Corporation, Vijayawada are responsible for implementing the operational guidelines.
The policy is issued with the remarks of the Finance (FMU-I&I, Energy and I&C) Department.
The policy aims to promote and enable the development of world-class Industrial Parks by private sector agencies in Andhra Pradesh.
The policy aims to enable the provision of world-class Operation & Maintenance in the Industrial Parks.
The policy aims to generate employment and attract investment by creating a conducive environment for investments in the state.
The policy aims to create an enabling framework for pooling land from farmers for the creation of Industrial Parks.
The policy aims to promote the establishment of sector-specific industrial parks.
The Department of Industries & Commerce, Government of Andhra Pradesh, or any other authorized agency, will be the executing agency for the Andhra Pradesh Private Industrial Parks Policy, 2024.
The policy shall be known as the Andhra Pradesh Policy for establishment of Private Industrial Parks with 'Plug and Play' Industrial Infrastructure (4.0) 2024-29.
The policy will come into force from the date of issuance of the Government Order (G.O.) and will remain in force for five years.
'APICDA' refers to the Andhra Pradesh Industrial Corridor Development Authority.
'APIC' refers to the Andhra Pradesh Industrial Infrastructure Corporation Limited.
'APMSMEDC' refers to the Andhra Pradesh Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises Development Corporation Limited.
'Commencement of Operations' refers to the commencement of commercial production/service of an industrial unit.

'Common Internal Infrastructure' includes facilities like internal roads, drainage, streetlights, water distribution, electricity distribution, communication network, effluent treatment plant, and common facilities centers within the Industrial Park.

'Completion of Industrial Park' means at least 50% of the land for industrial activity has been sold/leased, industrial units occupying at least 50% of that area have commenced operations, and at least 50% of the planned fixed capital investment (excluding land) has been incurred.
'Developer' refers to any entity that proposes to develop or develop and operate Industrial Parks, subject to applicable laws.
'DPR' means a detailed project report.
'Estimated Project Cost' includes fixed capital investment in building and infrastructure, cost of land, and cost of providing external infrastructure.
'Flatted Factory Complex (FFC)' is a multi-story industrial building divided into smaller units for various businesses.
'Financial Year' is a year beginning on April 1 and ending on March 31 of the succeeding year.
'GoAP' refers to the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
'IALA' refers to the Industrial Area Local Authority.
'Industrial Activity' includes manufacturing, software development, and other services.
'Industrial Park' is an area developed primarily for manufacturing/service units, including developed plots, residential/commercial establishments, warehousing, and common internal infrastructure.
'Facilities of the Industrial Parks under the Policy' are the facilities required to be present within the parks to be eligible for policy benefits.
'Industrial Unit' is a separate entity located in the Industrial Park carrying out Industrial Activity.
'Large Parks' cover a minimum area of 100 acres and up to 1,000 acres of contiguous land.
'Mega Parks' cover a minimum area of more than 1,000 acres of contiguous land.
'Legal Status' refers to the legal entity of the Developer at the time of DPR submission.
'MSME' refers to industrial units/enterprises as per the criteria notified by the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises of the Govt. of India.
'MSME Parks' are industrial parks spread over 10 to 100 acres of contiguous land, with most allotments made to MSME units.
'Single Desk Portal' refers to the portal set up under the Andhra Pradesh Single Desk Policy 2015 or any other GoAP policy.
'Nano or Tiny Parks' are industrial parks spread over less than 10 acres of contiguous land.
The Policy will cover locations that can be developed into Industrial Parks, including already notified industrial zones or locations with potential to be developed as industrial zones.
The Policy covers Nano or Tiny Parks (less than 10 acres), MSME Parks (10-100 acres), Large or Sector Specific Parks (100-1,000 acres), and Mega Parks (over 1,000 acres).
The policy targets industrial clusters/locations with high growth potential requiring strategic infrastructure support.

The Industrial Park proposed under this policy will have components including Land, Processing Area (Common Infrastructure, Industrial plots/buildings, Common facilities buildings), and Non-processing purposes (Business offices, Convention centers, Hotels, Housing, Schools, Hospitals, etc.).
The Project Cost for the policy includes costs for components listed under Group B (Processing Area).
Parks with Processing Units in sectors like Textile or Leather should strive for Zero Liquid Discharge CETP or a proper marine outfall.
The Policy promotes Plug n Play Industrial Parks and Flatted Factory Sheds, especially in Nano and MSME Parks.

Essential components of Plug n Play facilities include readily available roads, sewerage connection, electrical lines, water connection, natural gas pipeline, utility service-fire hydrants line, commercial center, and skill development center.

The Policy is also applicable to Specific Industrial Parks such as Biotechnology Park, Pharmaceutical Park, Toy Park, Electric Vehicles Park, Semiconductor Park, Defence and Aerospace Park, Food Processing Parks, Leather Parks, Textiles Parks, and Drone Manufacturing Parks.
Government will take necessary action to notify these parks under the Andhra Pradesh Industrial Corridor Development Act, 2017.
Desirable facilities within the Industrial Park include testing labs, training centers, trade centers, warehousing, packaging units, creche, canteen, workers' hostels, and marketing support systems.
'Good to Have' Facilities include convention centers, business offices, hotels, housing, schools, hospitals, and entertainment centers.
All Private Mega Industrial Parks and select Private Large Industrial Parks will be eligible for IALA status.
Layouts of Industrial Parks approved under the Policy will be approved expeditiously by APICDA or the concerned UDA without fees.
Building Plan approvals will be sanctioned by IALA or concerned Local Bodies through Single Desk Portal 2.0.
The Executing Agency and the Evaluation Committee shall handhold Private Developers for obtaining Environmental Clearance.
The Policy is flexible to accommodate various models of Park Development and Maintenance, including Joint Venture, Build Own Operate (BOO), and Design Build Finance Operate Transfer (DBFOT).
Private Developers may own the majority of lands or pool lands from farmers.
Three broad models for development of industrial parks with private sector participation are: complete private land, partial government/APIC land, and complete government/APIIC land.

In Model-ii (Partial Government/APIC Land), the Private Developer shares a proportionate number of developed plots with the Nodal Agency/APIC based on the extent of land consolidated by the Government/APIIC.
In Model-iii (Complete Government/APIIC Land), Private Developers are selected through a competitive bidding process managed by a Transaction Advisor.
The policy intends to provide flexibility to accommodate existing or innovatively conceptualized Industrial Park development models.
The final decision on the development model will be taken by the Evaluation Committee.
Incentives and subsidies will be provided upfront to Developers for the development of MSME Parks.
Capital Subsidy for Infrastructure Support will be released in a phased manner.
The main criterion for selection of proposals depends on the availability of external infrastructure like roads, water, and electricity.
Up to 100% exemption of Conversion Charges, charges for Change of Land Use, and Layout Approval are provided.
Up to 100% exemption of Stamp Duty and Registration Charges for pooling lands for Industrial Parks is provided.
Developers are eligible for a Capital Subsidy of up to Rs. 5 lakhs per acre for MSME Parks.
Capital Subsidy for MSME Parks is released in phases based on milestones like project approval, 25% progress, 75% progress, 100% completion, and operational park status.
Incentives and subsidies for MSME Parks are eligible after the lands are registered in the name of the Private Developer.
Incentives will be provided upfront to Developers for the development of Large and Mega Parks.
Capital Subsidy for Infrastructure Support for Large and Mega Parks will be released in a phased manner.
Developers are eligible for a Capital Subsidy of up to Rs. 3 lakhs per acre for Large and Mega Parks.
Developers are eligible for separate capital support for CETPs and Desalination Plants under the AP Industrial Development Policy, 4.0 or other schemes.
The policy encourages industrial projects to build housing and hostels for employees within 5 km of these Industrial parks.
Government will facilitate the development of Industrial housing facilities/Industrial Hostels in Mega Parks and select Large Parks, dovetailing Gol schemes.
Developers will be facilitated to get capital support for Industrial Housing and other social infrastructure projects, and for additional FSI in case of vertical buildings.
Capital Subsidy for Large and Mega Parks is released in phases based on milestones similar to MSME Parks.
Stakeholder Departments will facilitate Private Industrial Park Development.
Municipal Administration & Urban Development (MA&UD) Dept or APICA will approve change of land use.
Roads & Buildings Dept. or Panchayati Raj Dept. will facilitate external road connectivity.
Water Resources Dept. will facilitate water allocation.
DISCOMS will ensure priority provision of Sub Stations and laying of power lines.
Panchayati Raj & Rural Development (PR&RD) Dept. will facilitate utility provision in rural areas.
Andhra Pradesh Pollution Control Board (APPCB) will provide handholding for Environmental Clearance and dovetail schemes for CETPs.
APIC/APMSMEDC or any other notified agency will be the nodal agency for issuing EOI/RFP documents and evaluating proposals.
APMSMEDC will handle Tiny and MSME Parks, while APIIC will handle Large and Mega Parks.
APIC, APMSMEDC, or any other notified agency will formulate the External Infra Support Plan in consultation with stakeholder departments.
A Private Industrial Parks Evaluation Committee will be constituted to finalize the External Infra Support Plan and recommend proposals for approval.
The Finance Department will be part of the Evaluation Committee and consulted for proposals involving Gol/APIIC lands.
Proposals recommended by the Committee will be brought for approval of the Cabinet.
Approved Parks will be notified under the Andhra Pradesh Industrial Corridor Development Act, 2017 and become part of the State's Industrial Master Plan.
Govt. of AP will facilitate dovetailing of relevant Gol schemes for the support of select Private Industrial Parks.
Operating guidelines for this policy will be issued separately.
The Government of Andhra Pradesh is committed to creating 20 lakh employment opportunities over the next five years.
A Group of Ministers (GoM) has been constituted to suggest measures and institutionalize a monitoring mechanism for employment creation.
The GoM is chaired by Sri Nara Lokesh, Honâble Minister for Human Resources Development, IT Electronics & Communication; RTG; Skill Development.

Members of the GoM include Sri T G Bharath (Industries&Commerce, Food Processing), Sri Gottipati Ravi Kumar (Energy), Sri Kandula Durgesh (Tourism, Culture&Cinematography), Sri Ponguru Narayana (MA&UD), and Sri Kondapalli Srinivas (MS&ME, SERP and NRI Empowerment and Relations).

The GoM's terms of reference include suggesting measures to achieve employment objectives, reviewing progress, suggesting corrective measures, and recommending an institutional mechanism for monitoring employment.
Line Departments must nominate a senior official to participate in GoM meetings and provide regular updates.
The Skill Development and Training Department and the Director of Industries will provide secretarial assistance and support to the GoM.
The Industries & Commerce Department has issued G.O.MS.No. 70 dated 26-10-2024 regarding the constitution of the Group of Ministers (GoM).
The GoM is tasked with reviewing and suggesting measures towards the creation of 20 lakhs employment in the State of Andhra Pradesh.
